Review: Held to ransom by a ‚Äòreputable‚Äô company. Purchased a sim only plan March 2023 for my mobile dongle. Service was fine for a while then poor so stopped using the sim in early 2024 but continued to pay as I had been told in a Vodafone shop that I would have to pay the full remainder of the sim plan up front to cancel early. At the end of the contract in March 2025 my 24 months was up so stopped paying. At this point I had paid over ¬£350 for a service I had not used, which as I said above, upon the advice of the person at Vodafone, I accepted. Today, (5/6/25) I received a letter from Vodafone for the first time (that was not them trying to get me to purchase their home broadband) dated 30/5/25 saying I had an outstanding bill of ¬£67.18, which had been sent to a debt collector and would be reported to the CRA on 4/6/25 which had already passed when I got the letter. I called Vodafone immediately, explained the situation and they demanded a payment of ¬£98.32 for 3 months of service that they continued to provide me as they said there was no record of my attempt to end the contract in 2024 or my issues with the poor service. I said to them that I had paid til the end of my contract and then cancelled but they said there was no record and that in order to cancel and avoid further charges I had to pay the almost ¬£100 which I certainly cannot afford. I an raising a formal complaint as I am disgusted by this greed and poor service. I want others to avoid the same experience that I have had. They‚Äôll happily take your money for a service they‚Äôre not providing. Recon they will still report to the CRA despite holding me to ransom and forcing me to pay something I can‚Äôt afford. Appalled. Avoid at all costs.

Review: I was a customer of BT‚Äôs full fibre service for two years, and switched to Vodafone only because of a cheaper offer ‚Äî and I deeply regret it! This service is not even enough for checking your email
Name: Mo Shakoori

Review: After a formal complaint and a lengthy back-and-forth, Vodafone finally agreed to reduce my airtime from ¬£25.46 to around ¬£11 a month and credited my account with ¬£50 ‚Äî supposedly covering two months. I thought the issue was resolved.Then suddenly, on 4 June, Vodafone took three separate payments from my account:‚Ä¢ ¬£25.46 (airtime ‚Äî which was supposed to be reduced!)‚Ä¢ ¬£10.00 (device)‚Ä¢ ¬£12.00 (device)I‚Äôm not disputing the device charges ‚Äî but the ¬£25.46 goes directly against what was agreed. Once again, I‚Äôm left chasing Vodafone for money I didn‚Äôt consent to pay, after being told this was sorted.This situation has added unnecessary financial pressure and stress, especially when I‚Äôve done everything Vodafone asked and acted in good faith. I‚Äôve now had to escalate again and CC the CEO. Why should I keep dealing with mistakes that Vodafone promised were resolved?This is unacceptable, and I hope this public review helps push for accountability ‚Äî again.After reaching a formal agreement with Vodafone (Ref: 138249138), I was told my airtime bill would drop from ¬£25.46 to around ¬£11/month and that I had been credited ¬£50 to cover the next two months. I was finally starting to feel some relief after all the stress I‚Äôd already gone through.But despite this agreement, Vodafone took the full ¬£25.46 airtime payment again on 4 June ‚Äî on top of the ¬£10 and ¬£12 device plan payments. I never disputed the device charges, but the airtime charge should NOT have been taken.This isn't just a technical error ‚Äî it‚Äôs had a real and serious impact on me. I am already in a financial crisis, and this unnecessary charge has made things worse. I feel crippled by stress from having to deal with Vodafone over and over, especially after the rude and dismissive treatment I received from one of their representatives. That experience alone left a lasting emotional impact I still haven‚Äôt been able to move past.To feel some hope through a resolution, only to have it undone without explanation, has made things worse than before. This isn‚Äôt just poor service ‚Äî it‚Äôs neglectful and harmful.I've now had to escalate this again and CC Vodafone's CEO, Max Taylor, in my latest complaint. I‚Äôm also prepared to go to CISAS if this is not resolved swiftly and fairly. Enough is enough.
Name: Farida Ali

Review: I upgraded my device with the option to trade in - this was for the value of ¬£400.I was under the assumption that the ¬£400 credit would be applied to my account and I would pay my bill as usual. Vodafone received my device and confirmed the ¬£400 credit with a green banner within the MyVodafone app that stated "You have ¬£400 account credit".When it came to paying my bill, I received a notification that my Direct Debit would be ¬£400 higher this month. I called Vodafone and they advised that the credit could not be applied to my current bill, but I could use it on the next one. Meaning I would be ¬£400 down for a month. I am not really in a position to be able to do this, which is why I traded in the old device. I called Vodafone and asked if this could be refunded to my bank account if I made the payment - I was advised it could be. I hesitated paying this, as it would (and now has) put me in a difficult financial situation - I cannot be without broadband and mobile as I work from home, so today I paid the bill.I called Vodafone to ask about this credit being returned to me, and honestly feel like my intelligence is being questioned.. The agent I spoke to (Loretta) was very helpful, but told me initially that it owuldn't be possible to have the credit paid out to me as "it is still accruing in the account, and is currently only at ¬£393.." this makes absolutely no sense. Loretta went away to speak to some other team and came back and said that it would not be possible as that credit has not been "allocated".. even though I can see in a big green box that I have ¬£400 credit. I then asked Loretta if I could then just have the ¬£393, if that is what has "accrued". She went away again to speak to another team for quite a while and then came back to tell me this is not possible and I would have to wait until the next billing cycle. I then asked Loretta if she could confirm that that account credit would still be available when my next bill is issued, rather than being used to pay the bill and she said "No, we will deduct the billed amount before sending the funds"I really feel like my intelligence is being insulted.. the account credit is there, it is not "accruing" - the device I traded in was a whole device, I didn't send it piece by piece so it makes no sense that the credit would "accrue". I understand that companies want to do as much as they can to not have to transfer funds out, but I was told that this was possible, without any caveats about the credit needing to accrue, or be allocated (it clearly has been allocated as I can see available credit within my app to be used!Please either arrange for a refund or return my device. I am now out of pocket due to a very poorly executed trade-in process and a billing team that clearly just want to try to avoid making any payouts.
Name: Den

Review: 10 weeks from planned activation date, Openreach finally finished the incomplete work to install our Full Fibre connection! Vodafone then instruct our current provider to disconnect us and leave us with no Internet connection at all!It's a very long story:Ordered our Vodafone full fibre on 7th JanChoose 1st available Openreach appointment - March 21st.  Prior to this, Openreach contractors dug up the path at the end of our driveway, not very neatly21st March arrives and Openreach engineer tells us he cannot fit the cable to the house becausethe initial ground works were not completed correctly. No rope to pull cable through conduit, ground junction box is filled with tarmac, no connection box installed on wall.2nd engineer apt is made for March 28th - still unable to complete as apparently there is a blockage!I chat every week to Vodafone who blame the issue on Opereach and every week say there is a blockage that requires a specialist engineer - the issue is with the chief engineer who has a heavy workload!On 17th may Vodafone say Openreach promise the work will be done by 23rd May which as predicted does not happen!23rd May - Vodafone agent has the sense to tell me they are raising an official escalation with Openreach. Unsure why this hasn't been done by any other of the agents until so far down the line!2nd June - Openreach engineer calls me and says will arrive in 20mins. Finishes the connection within half hour and says it is up and running. He doesn't know what the blockage or issue is meant to be as he has no problem running the cable inside or connecting the router so who knows what we have been waiting for over the last 10 weeks!Shortly after he leaves, Vodafone instruct my provider to disconnect but the new Vodafone connection doesn't start working!That afternoon, I spend 1hr speaking to tech support going through troubleshooting and they finally tell me they will send a new router as firmware out of date.3rd June - I chat online to ask for confirmation the router will arrive today. Tech support now tell me that there is nothing wrong with the router as it is a new Power Hub!Whilst another agent is trying to find out what the issue is, I get disconnected from my mobile data as a result of trying to connect to WiFi as asked.  I then reconnect to yet another agent!I reconnect to another agent and speak to him for an hour, switching, unplugging, resetting, updating etc then get disconnected again as I am relying on mobile data!I rejoin the queue and chat to agent no 3, really loosing hope now! They then say they will pass me to the activations team as my order is still in open status! They have obviously admitted defeat! I asked to speak to a manager but apparently I have to speak to an activations team member first! Speak to this team member who asks me yet again to reset the router and updates something their end! Of course it doesn't make any difference and they transfer me to a manager. Turns out yesterday's promised router won't arrive until tomorrow but they place yet another order to send a 2nd one out today! They have gone back to believing the router needs replacing because of the firmware which strangely can't be done remotely. Speak to shift mgr who just repeats what I have already been told.  End my chat at 4hrs!4th June - Amazingly, the new router arrives and actually connects to the new network! I'm hoping this is the last time I need to chat to Vodafone but am not optimistic! Since January we have been paying ¬£14 more per mth to our existing provider as we are out of contract! The max compensation Vodafone will pay is ¬£374.40 (¬£6.24 x 60 days) This is the only reason we haven't cancelled. We also have 2 Vodafone mobile contracts in the household but although the internet is up and running now, I will not be choosing Vodafone for anything again in the future, due to how this was handled. I have been told today, the compensation won't be applied to my account until August. The least they could do is apply it to the 1st bill

Review: Having been with Vodafone for at least 10 years now, I decided to leave this year, as the offers weren't as cheap anymore for what I need. I never cared much for the latest phone but needed roaming, minutes and texts as well as some data. Due to my job, I received 20% off the bill and still paid about ¬£28 per month. This doesn't appear a lot compared to some people who pay ¬£50-¬£60 with a phone included but overall, they have always been responsive and helpful. The network is hit and miss at times but I can't fault them for having been a good company but unfortunately your rates don't compare to other companies these days, who offer similar Sim only deals for half the price. Now I pay ¬£7 per month with no price rises, roaming included, unlimited texts and minutes and 30GB data per month, which rolls over, so ideal for me.

Review: I have been a Vodafone broadband customer for since last 3 years; I started facing issues 1 year later. I am out of my Vodafone contract since October 2025. Now I left my old rented home on May 19, 2025 .When I requested for a disconnection with Vodafone on 25 April 2025 they told they could only disconnect on 26th May 2025. So I agreed, and they raised the disconnection request. I got a confirmation email and a sorry to see u go email on the same day from Vodafone. Then After 3 weeks, on May 14, they took the bill for June and send another confirmation email saying i am disconnecting services on 27th of June. When I approached the Vodafone support, they didn't have any clue they escalated to 3 different teams, wasted 3 hours in chat and later they told I wouldn't be able to disconnect because the new tenant raised an connection request with another vendor, and hence I need to continue to pay the bill until they find the issue. So I removed my debit last week, as I am not using the internet, and moved out of the rented house on 19th MAY. although  I already lost the payment taken for June month .The reason is so silly; I don't know how a reputed company can behave in a stupid way.  After all these conversations, the customer care team is asking me to take a mobile data plan which looks like they are least bothered about their customer concerns rather than selling their product. Now I can see a couple of bills have been generated till July 2025 hope they will continue for an infinite number of day even though they don't have any connection. I am not sure what to do. Do I need to go to consumer court or complain about this to Ofcom? Anyone, please advice .

A problem with the conduit meant that I went into the 3-week wait till next visit by the civils team - great people and they seemed to fix it, just that Vodafone don't seem to have bothered to update anything - "fob him off, we don't want to chase anything" seems to be the team motto. Review: Today, while on my way to do my grocery shopping, I came across a distressed woman‚Äîshe was homeless and had special needs. She couldn‚Äôt top up her phone and didn‚Äôt understand why. I checked the phone for her: the device was working fine and could dial out, but none of the top-up service numbers were functioning.After a quick search, I saw a surge in complaints about Vodafone outages. It looked like whatever issue was affecting your systems had also taken out the top-up service.This woman was already going through a lot‚Äîher husband had recently passed away, and she was trying to sort out essential things like medical appointments and other urgent support. Being cut off from her only means of communication was the last thing she needed.I contacted Vodafone support using my own phone and waited 30 minutes before being transferred to the top-up line. The person I spoke to gave me a number, then immediately tried to end the call. I stopped her‚Äîafter waiting that long, I wasn‚Äôt going to be left without answers. But the number didn‚Äôt work. Neither of the two numbers she gave me worked.In the end, I used my own debit card to top up the woman‚Äôs phone, because there was no working way to do it otherwise.Please investigate this. Your system failure left a vulnerable person cut off and unsupported, and that‚Äôs not just a technical issue‚Äîit has real human consequences.
Name: Yves Wheeler

Review: I ordered fibre broadband from Vodafone on 29/11/2024. It is now June 2025 and I am still not connected. Their complaints service is next to useless - you communicate with a customer service centre that has no idea what is going on and no idea how to resolve problems. They ignore specific questions and request for escalation. They say it's not their fault or Openreach's fault but because civils are required to bring the line from the other side of the street so surveys are required by Openreach. In fact Openreach have 3 times sent people to carry out a survey and come up with a solution for connection. $ times Openreach have sent people to connect my home to the line that they haven't put in yet.Vodafone seem to have no basic service level agreement with Openreach or are not enforcing it. On the positive side they have sent me two broadband routers!

Review: Contacted for an up to date delivery date for broadband router. For most companies this requires confirmation of a few details e.g. order number, post code, etc. and admittedly I should have been more prepared with details to hand. However, for Vodafone you have to even recall the last contact you had with them and whether this was over chat, email or phone. The whole process must have taken around 30 minutes. Had to wait a long time between responses from Vodafone customer service agent and was given many non-responses and time fillers e.g. "I am checking the details" which likely meant "I am helping another customer". Every time my connection dropped slightly I received a  reply saying they had not heard from me in quite some time despite me having to wait a long time between their responses. Let's just hope the broadband is better than their customer service so I don't have to contact them again.  Would not recommend using the chat service at all if possible and next time I will phone but for people who rely on chat for accessibility reasons this would not be possible. I think I've unfortunately passed the 14 day cooling off period as my soonest activation date and delivery date were a long time from my order date otherwise I would probably be cancelling my order and going with another provider.
Name: Jessica Murray

Review: New switch to Vodafone - took months to connect up, which wasn't an issue for me as understood they needed to connect the line in under a road. However then my issues started, on switch day the new router didn't work and they turned the previous supplier off so left me without the internet for a work day (and I work from home) They had to post a new router out which needed to be signed for, however they did not understand that being in to sign for this when I had to do 5 hour round trip to the office to be able to work, was not understood. Just over 2 weeks later, no internet on Saturday but then came back and started working this morning ok and now it's gone again - they need to send an Openreach engineer, coming tomorrow - no internet again and over an hour on the phone to them, absolutely awful service and wishing I'd never switched to them, customer service is appalling!

Review: Phone constantly defaults to 'E' Edge network, I have to toggle airplane mode on and off for it pick up 4G again.  I spent a couple of hours troubleshooting it without a resolution, It has been escalated to the "network team' twice (they closed the first ticket off without any communication).  I got them to open another ticket and they have requested screenshots of my phone screen and postcode of where I was at the time, I sent 2 over and now they say they need 3 screenshots with exact times, oh and I can only send them over betwen Thursday and Sunday!?? Are Vodafone a Mickey Mouse company now?  They have now closed off the second ticket!! I cant help feeling they dont really want to help and they know there is a wider issue since the 3G service was switched off.  I will be looking to close my account ASAP as this is shocking customer service towards a customer who has been with the for several years now....

Review: I contacted Vodafone after closing my bank account and asked them to cancel the direct debit as the account no longer exists. They refused. I tried again a few days later and explained as if I was talking to a child that it would cause problems with my payment if the direct debit is attempted.They again refused to cancel the direct debit. This went on for multiple phone calls and multiple complaints.The direct debit was taken out of the closed bank account indicating the payment was made. I made a manual payment.The direct debit was then returned to the bank in question. The next day I get a text and email saying my bill is unpaid. Now they are saying I haven't made my bill payment and I have to pay them again. If I don't my account will be restricted and I'll receive late payment fees.So, I explain the bank account in question is closed. I explain that the direct debit will fail and cause me to have a late payment or it'll cause problems with the manual payment. Yet they knowingly refuse to act accordingly putting my finances, and communications at risk. The company hasn't changed in 15 years. Still thieves and liars.I would strongly recommend anyone considering joining Vodafone looks for a different communication provider. Vodafone will destroy your credit score, they will destroy your mental health, they will destroy your life. And they will make you pay for the privilege.Got a text at 6.45 This morning saying I'd get a callback between 12 and 2 today. It goes past 2pm and I call to find out what happened. Only to be told the agent who text me isn't at work today. The whole company is absolutely useless. Full of liars and thieves.I've wasted all the time I'm prepared. If my problem isn't fixed today I'll close my accounts. I'm not dealing with thieves and liars

Review: I ordered a new phone on their website for delivery 2 days later. I had to contact them 2 days later as I hadn‚Äôt received any further communication and they promised I‚Äôd hear back within 48 hours. After 48 hours I contacted them again as I still hadn‚Äôt received any communication and I was told the phone was ‚Äòstuck‚Äô at the warehouse but that they ‚Äòguarantee‚Äô I‚Äôll hear from them within 7 days‚Ä¶ contacted them again 8 days later as I still hadn‚Äôt received any contact at all from them and was told the order had to be cancelled because the warehouse didn‚Äôt receive the signed plan - the same signed plan I was sent via email on the day I ordered. Even when I offered to send them the signed document they had sent me with the time stamp of the day of purchase they couldn‚Äôt accept. Clearly some issues with their warehouse and sales/website not communicating and a complete void of any customer service as not once have I been contacted to apologise for the inconvenience of not receiving my order or having to contact them to find out what‚Äôs happening rather than the other way around. Review: On 24th May I topped up my pay as you go mobile with ¬£10 using the internet. I gave my card details and was successful. Instead of receiving the usual Vodafone confirmation I  received one from ''prepaidmobilerecharge.com'' On checking I discovered the the original balance had disappeared and my balance was ¬£10. Was I scammed. On speaking with Vodafone it turned out that because another company used what appeared to be the official Vodafone  web site I had been tricked into giving scammers my Debit card details. Posting my complaint on to the scam website ''prepaidmobilerecharge.com''my rating was changed from 1 Star to 4 stars
Name: Colin Fellows

Review: I‚Äôm one of those people that chop and change broadband providers to get a good deal so I went with Vodafone despite reading bad reviews, thinking ‚Äò they‚Äôre a big company I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll be fine‚Äô.I was wrong.Customer service is terrible, impossible to get hold of ( one time over an hour and a half on hold and still no answer). Total incompetence from staff as well, one will say one thing and you‚Äôll get past around from one department to another and the next person will contradict the previous person on what is causing an issue ect. I spent over 3 hours one night trying to get our internet working after activation after a house move and it was painful tbh. I got nowhere and in the end I gave up. I tried again the next night on their Tobi online chat and this time I was hit with different reasons as to why it was still not working. Again no connection. At this point I went on my sky app to go back with them as I‚Äôd had enough, so then tried to leave Vodafone which was also ridiculously impossible. Was I at the beginning of a contact as I‚Äôd just moved or was I still on monthly rolling as I‚Äôd been with them nearly two years? Again I was getting mixed messages from Vodafone with one person saying one thing and the next one saying the opposite. It was almost like a wind up the service was so bad.I was also told  that the 3 weeks I wasn‚Äôt receiving any service after moving house that I would not be getting changed, but guess what? They did charge me the full amount!In the end, in their compete and utter uselessness they mucked up in my favour as on the third consecutive night of phoning them I actually spoke to a ‚ÄòSamantha‚Äô who tbh was the only decent staff member I dealt with. While on the phone basically pleading with her to just cancel my service so I could go elsewhere she mentioned I took out my contract with them  STARTING IN DECEMBER 2025 when we were still in MAY 2025! I told her to repeat what she just said and as she was doing so stopped mid sentence and realised the total ball‚Äôs up in apparently starting a contract in the future. This was my get out as the contract was null and void and she agreed to cancel my contract immediately! Phew!! Samantha admitted she had no idea how that had happened, and it was for me at least my get out from the worst service by a country mile I‚Äôve ever encountered from any company regardless of size let alone a big one like Vodafone.TLTR. Don‚Äôt be like me and ignore the negative reviews like I did, thinking you‚Äôll be ok. You won‚Äôt.
Name: Aaron Hudson

Review: Excellent customer service from Leanne. She explained everything very clearly and provided me with the best deal she could offer. Always have a great experience when visiting this store.
Name: Mr Morgan

Review: Switched from Plusnet to Vodafone due to very unstable connection, as soon as the switch completed I have had zero problems. the router and extender also work flawlessly.
Name: Eduardo Conde

Review: They sold me fibre 150 which guaranteed at least 75mb but i never get anything above 40mb.  They use the excuse that they can only guarantee speeds if your connected via cable which nobody can really do as most routers are in a cupboard in a hallway.  They then have the cheek to offer you booster boxes which would increase your bill and if you want to cancel its over ¬£100 so your basically trapped with rubbish internet. Dont get me started on customer service, yes you will always get through to someone after waiting but they never offer you a solution and talk to you like your a child after jumping through hoop after hoop before you even get to speak about your issue.
Name: Mark Miller

Review: Back in January I spoke to Vodafone as I had changed jobs and my pay day meant I would have to change my payment date to 1st of each month, they confirmed it wouldn‚Äôt be a problem and due to billing cycle wouldn‚Äôt take affect until March. Spoke to Vodafone today as my direct debit was meant to be taken on 1st of each month, explained they took the bill early which has meant I have gone overdrawn (pay day is tomorrow) Spent two long hours on the phone and I was told it was mistake their end but it‚Äôs impossible to move billing cycle so I should have never been told the 1st is ok. By way of recompense they offered ¬£5 Morrisons voucher. I explained this should never have happened and the overdraft fee alone would be more than this paltry amount. The lady disappeared and offered a ¬£10 e voucher on her return. Each time she said that it was the best she could do. Clearly both were lies! So even though it‚Äôs Vodafone mess up nothing was offered as fair compensation. Luckily I‚Äôm out of fixed contracts with Vodafone and have moved all my accounts elsewhere which is a shame as I had been with them for the better part of 18 years. After numerous mess ups over the years this was the final straw. They did offer to match what I had found but still couldn‚Äôt move my direct debit to the 1st of each mont, had they been able to do that I would have been tempted to stay. After testing my wired/wifi connection also turns out I‚Äôm getting less than their minimum guaranteed! (I have gigafast package) Also the lack of 5g in my area is also annoying. I feel Vodafone can and should be doing more for their loyal customers.
Name: Leigh Mcshane

Review: I've been with Vodafone for some time now and I really can't wait to get out of my contract so I can find another provider. I can't stream without there being some kind of connection issues.nive spoken to multiple agents at the company all of which have no idea what they're doing! The last agent I spoke to transferred me to about 3 or 4 different people and I ended up with someone trying to sign me up as a new customer!!! Absolute shambles! Any review telling you Vodafone is the best overall provider must be lying. If I was you, I'd avoid at all costs. For a company that is legally contracted to provide a paid service, they do the complete opposite. I'm going to call Vodafone and demand they cancel the contract on their behalf due to their failure of providing the service I'm paying for!

Review: This has been a terrible experience with Vodafone. I needed to move home while still under contract with them. I called more than two weeks before my moving date to arrange broadband activation at my new address. The customer service representative assured me that someone would come to install and activate the broadband on the scheduled day.However, no one showed up, and I received no communication or updates. I then called customer service and spent over an hour on the phone. The representative promised that her manager would call me back within 24 to 48 hours ‚Äî but, once again, no one followed through.After five days without internet and no updates, I called again. This time, someone based in the UK informed me that the installation had been rescheduled for more than a week later. I requested compensation, as I would be without internet for almost half a month while still being charged the full monthly fee. The customer service agent, however, made every excuse to avoid offering any compensation.It was only after I mentioned reporting the issue to Ofcom that the agent finally took the matter seriously and said she would check for an earlier installation date. The new date is now six days away, but I have still received no compensation for being without internet for over 10 days ‚Äî not to mention the stress and frustration of dealing with their customer service.This has been a dreadful experience. I used to live in the U.S., and people often complained about AT&T ‚Äî a provider I used for many years. But compared to Vodafone, AT&T feels like an angel. I will I will report my case to Ofcom anyway.
Name: Jason

Review: What was that? You want the best phone network,WiFi and customer service all in one? Then go to Vodafone. Vodafone are great. Now I must say, they used to have a problem with dropping to EDGE quite a lot, now they‚Äôve fixed it and I‚Äôve not seen EDGE for ages. If you live in a cityfibre area as well, you have GIGABIT wifi for ¬£29 or ¬£27 if you are a sim customer. Customer service was great. Helped me get a new unlimited sim for ¬£21 and helped me get a new gigacube when the sim didn‚Äôt fit in the first one.The only criticism I have is that the latency on the gigacube is high, but I‚Äôd imagine it would be the same if you had o2 mobile internet for eg. It‚Äôs miles ahead of a certain network that is owned by the BT group and begins with E

Review: My Internet didn't work for 3 months, going through vodafone phone system to try and resolve the issue is unbearable, everytime on hold for at least 45min before anyone picks up only to be transferred from department to department. Every question I asked involves me being put on hold for 20min wile they have to ask someone else for an answer. Everything I told them about the Internet not working involves them having to tell someone else and again being put on hold for another 20min. OUTRAGEOUS!!!Once the problem was raised they send me a txt message in the evening saying the problem had been resolved when it haven't. So the next day I had to do it all again, for 3 months. The total time I was on the phone to them was well over 40hours. OUTRAGEOUS!!! I have been through terrible phone systems before from other companies but nothing even comes close to how bad vodafone are. During the 3 months my Internet didn't work they never forgot to charge me. Eventually after 3 months they got my Internet working, I asked them about getting a refund, they said I get a refund for the period of time my Internet was down but it won't be applied to my account for 2 months, 3 months later I was still being charged, I rang them again to ask why? Another 45min just to get through to someone, everything I asked involves me being put on hold for 15min to get an answer, eventually they said I was owed a refund and can I stay on hold wile they calculated it, it took over an hour to work out apparently because my Internet was down for so long only for them to say I'm not getting any refund. I asked why? Another 15min on hold to be told because I missed 1 call from them (because I was at work and couldn't pick up my phone) that is enough of a reason for them to say I delayed the process. I asked when was this call? Another 20min on hold to be told it was 2 months into my Internet being down. So no refund even for the 2 months before this apparently phone call, OUTRAGEOUS!!! And that's all they need to deny you any refund at all for not providing a service there charging you for.If you speak to vodafone wanting to take out a contract you go through to an English call centre, if you have a problem you go though to an Indian call centre, where the hold times are insane OUTRAGIOUS!!! Like I said total time I was on the phone to vodafone was over 40 hours and probably more like 60hours. I've never known anything like it.

Review: Location: Cambridgelets start about a year ago, and everywhere I went around Cambridge and the surrounding areas I was struggling to get a signal on vodafone. I called and they ran me through the usual of getting the most up to date carrier settings for my phone (this was repeated many times I called vodafone), but this did not fix the issue. The phone was not the issue as I bought a Pixel 9 and experienced the same issue.I had a strong signal (full 4G) but I could not get and bandwidth and it became so bad that at around 4-6pm, if I wanted to make a call, I would have to disable 4G to actually make a call.I reported all this to vodafone, but nobody on the team could understand the difference between signal and bandwidth.Fast forward to just recently, and I called asking to cancel my contract, at first they tried to run me through troubleshooting, then asking what I had been offered in other places, and after 20 minutes of me refusing to answer their questions and just asking to cancel my contract, they put the phone down.I called again very angry and luckily had somebody that just processed the cancellation with no questions, however it took over 30 minutes to do this.Not had any issues on EE yet, but I will not be touching Vodafone againEdit: I'm gone, you can't get me back. Do better with the customers you have and train your staff to understand why a client might get no data despite having full signal. I won't be wasting anymore time talking to your poor customer support

Review: I made a decision to switch from current BB provider to Vodafone after reading reviews. Ordered the home BB service on 9th May 2025 via Uswitch link as they were offering a ¬£90 gift card reward.Received email confirmation and chose installation date as Thursday 29th May. Email stated that equipment would arrive 3 working days before installation date which I realised would be a bank holiday Monday.I called up to enquire about the installation only to be informed that the order had been cancelled without any explanation. First customer service staff member blamed uSwitch and said they had cancelled.I emailed uSwitch and they responded promptly saying they did not store any information on their systems as all information and order would have been processed and credit checks done through the Vodafone website.I called customer service again. This time it was a lady on the phone who checked account again and informed me that the order had been cancelled and the account was credit check pending. Lady offered to reorder which I declined as that meant I would lose out on the ¬£90 cash back offer from uSwitch.Within the last two weeks there was no communication via email or phone to inform me of the status of my order. I only learnt of the outcome when I phoned up.And now seeing there are 30% complaints with customers leaving 1 start reviews, I am contemplating of remaining with my current home BB provider.
Name: Sohail Anjum

Review: Appalling service. Ordered a data sim. Not activated on arrival, several phone calls to try to resolve the issue. Ended up calling to cancel, which i was assured was done. Only to recieve more emails saying the account was active. Called to check, only to be told i would now be liable for 'early termination fees' even though i was within the 14 day cool off period & the device never worked.  I purchased a sim from a provider that piggy backs of their network, went online, activated immediately. First & last time i deal with Vodafone.

Review: Vodafone has delivered, without a doubt, the worst customer service I‚Äôve ever encountered. I‚Äôve been a customer for over six months, and during this time, I‚Äôve been completely unable to access my account. This has prevented me from resetting up a direct debit, which has led to overcharge and unjustified late fees.I‚Äôve spent more than four hours on the phone with their support team, being bounced around between departments, only to be told time and again that ‚Äúthere‚Äôs nothing they can do.‚Äù Not only have they failed to fix the issue, they refuse to take responsibility or even remove the fees caused by their own broken systems. They also refuse to transfer me to their managers. The only thing vodafone proposes to its clients is to pay more, for an unexistant service.The level of incompetence and indifference is staggering. Vodafone clearly has no interest in helping their customers, resolving issues, or even providing basic functionality. It‚Äôs astonishing that a major telecom company can operate with such a blatant disregard for its customers.I will be filing a formal complaint with the Communication & Internet Services Adjudication Scheme (CISAS). If you‚Äôre considering Vodafone‚Äîdon‚Äôt. Spare yourself the stress and look elsewhere.Edit: the late fee has been cancelled after 2h30 on the phone. But I am still not able to connect to my account.

Review: I recently joined Vodafone but am beginning to regret this decision. I changed bank current accounts which resulted in a direct debit for Vodafone not being transferred over. As soon as they alerted me to this fact I set up anew one the same day. Despite this I was charged a fee by Vodafone for payment being less than a week late. I tried to query Vodafone‚Äôs eagerness to charge a fee but I found to my cost that their customer service is woeful. There is no way to email Vodafone, instead you are directed to a totally inept web chat that I assume is manned by poorly trained call centre staff working from a script. Vodafone appear to copying Amazon‚Äôs lead by making it difficult to lodge a formal complaint in the hope that people will just give up. I have emailed Vodafone‚Äôs CEO to pass on my complaint but it seems that he too is not interested in dealing with adverse customer feedback. As yet I‚Äôve had no reply.I would advise anyone to avoid Vodafone and will be changing provider as soon as my contract is up.I‚Äôm sure that I will get a generic response from Vodafone directing me to a Facebook page if I wish to discuss the matter further. I do not, nor do I wish to join Facebook.

Review: ‚ÄúFacebook‚Äôs ‚ÄòSupport‚Äô is a Joke ‚Äì No Resolution, Endless Neglect!‚Äù  Despite repeatedly explaining my problem via chat (with an actual human agent!), Facebook has done absolutely nothing to resolve it. I‚Äôve been complaining since yesterday, and instead of action, I‚Äôm stuck in a loop of incompetence. Their own staff said I want be charged but they charged me and now they are still waiting for final bill. Vodafone Stole my money. And there are liers in customer service call. They are made to lie to customer by Vodafone.The So-Called ‚ÄúSupport‚Äù: No urgency: After 24+ hours, they still ask for my name and mobile number‚Äì details I‚Äôve already provided MULTIPLE times.  -Zero progress: Agents acknowledge the complaint but refuse to escalate or fix anything. It‚Äôs like talking to a brick wall.  -Negligence:  My case is clearly being ignored. Their team prioritizes stalling over solving.  Final Thoughts:This isn‚Äôt just bad service ‚Äì it‚Äôs willful neglect. If Facebook can‚Äôt handle basic complaints without stonewalling customers, they shouldn‚Äôt offer ‚Äúsupport‚Äù at all.  Warning to Others: ‚ö†Ô∏è Avoid relying on Facebook for anything requiring customer care. You‚Äôll waste hours repeating yourself, only to be ghosted.  To Facebook:Train your team to stop asking for the same info and actually resolve issues. This disrespectful runaround is how you alienate users for good.

Review: Used to be the best, now just being bad on purpose I suspect to maintain revenue.I can‚Äôt manage my family‚Äôs phone accounts in one place anymore in preparation for a holiday.The app is designed to frustrate, it used to be good, then it got worse, now it‚Äôs a joke.Basic tasks like logging out, changing spend caps, or managing bolt ons are buried under vague menus or outright blocked or hidden. Want to switch between numbers? Good luck. There‚Äôs no logout button, just a digital hostage situation.Tobi, the so-called chatbot, is less ‚ÄúAI assistant‚Äù and more a geriatric bingo caller throwing random words at your questions.Want to use the support pages? You may as well ask your pet dog to search for the answer.Every update seems designed to remove features, not improve them. The app routinely redirects you to broken web pages, freezes on load, or loops endlessly between logins.This isn‚Äôt a service tool anymore. It‚Äôs a revenue-l preservation device masquerading as an app. Designed to frustrate, And it‚Äôs working, because I‚Äôm finally giving up and changing provider after 20+ years as a Vodafone customer.
Name: Joe Dickson

Review: Update on Vodafone service. Having waited since January 23 to activate broadband and telephone to the home of a severely disabled elderly lady I can report that the router has been installed in a location that conflicts with published instruction issued by Vodafone. Unable to connect her devices the help of the Vodafone  Bridgwater shop said ‚ÄúVodafone operatives aren‚Äôt insured to enter customers homes‚Äù. As I‚Äôm advised that subcontractors conduct Vodafone installations it surely follows that they too aren‚Äôt insured. Should you have challenging health condition do NOT rely on this company for assistance as you will be disappointed. How then when requested to assist disabled people who need assistance connecting devices do they serve all customers if they aren‚Äôt insured to enter your home? It appears that Vodafone is just a name and all actual work is conducted using subcontractors. Forget this company if you need any assistance due to personal circumstances and or assistance as they aren‚Äôt interested.
Name: Colin

Half spent dealing with a useless chat bot and two with a human who couldn't help. When I signed in it sent an SMS to my landline with a signon code which said 'zero minutes'. It turns out they cannot send SMS to a landline so why did they allow me to attach my landline in the first place! The chatbot was useless and the human wasn't much help. after 30 minutes they told me I failed security so had to go to a store. Another wait and it took 20 minutes to get it sorted. Vodafone is another robotic company when if your query doesn't fit with their program you get no where. If I could have e-mailed them I would not have had to hang on.

Review: FTTP Broadband from Vodafone:I've just had a truly dreadful experience with Vodafone and thought I would warn others.My 1.6Gbps FTTP service was installed yesterday at the second attempt (8 days after it should have been). The service worked at the advertised speeds getting 1.6Gbps during the day and being throttled to their 'guaranteed minimum' 800Mbps later in the evening and through midnight and beyond.The issue is that the supplied Ultra Hub only has 1 x 2.5Gbps port (which is used for the ONT incoming fibre connection) and 4 x 1Gbps ports which obviously can't supply the 1.6Gbps I paid for to my wired 10Gbps intranet and BE85 WiFi7 mesh system.As I'm only on day 2 of the 'cooling off period' I tried to get Vodafone to simply swap the Router for the one they now include in the exact same 1.6Gbps package. Should have been easy, Right? Wrong! Chat to AI bot and then Agent last night got me nothing except 'call a number tomorrow'. I did. The first agent at least tried to be helpful but couldn't do what was needed. The second agent in termination/retentions frankly couldn't give a damn so I simply terminated the contract.I've now ordered a 1.6Gbps service from EE (who also guarantee a minimum 1.3Gbps which is much better than Vodafone's 800 minimum!).I only need a Hub that works and feeds into my existing intranet so customer service should not be needed (I've heard that EE aren't great either).I would now have to suggest very strongly that people avoid Vodafone based on my experience (as a pre-existing broadband user). I didn't have any problems with them before, but they failed me with what should have been a very simple replacement task.Obviously this speed issue only applies to plans above 1 Gbps, but I would also add that it was impossible to get the supplied WiFi Extender to pair, and I'm a computer geek having worked in the industry all my life. The pairing issue is apparently very common. Caveat Emptor!Edit: I reached out to Vodafone via Facebook messaging as requested in their response, went through the exact same process I'd previously already gone through 3 times today, and eventually got told to phone another landline number for an IMMEDIATE disconnect! I had requested Saturday midnight. Talk about adding insult to injury. I can only think they are trying to force me beyond the 14 day no cancellation fee deadline.Please note right here that I tried to cancel this 4 times today May 20th 2025 and I expect that request to be honored and no early termination fee charged!I was also unable to raise a formal complaint, but told the details for that were on their website!
Name: Colin Dyckes

Review: Zero is not available unfortunately. I have never had such a shockingly bad customer experience. I transferred my service to Vodafone broadband from Virgin Media in April. When it transferred I contacted Virgin to enquire about returning my equipment and was told my service hadn't been cancelled with them by Vodafone. Vodafone initially claimed that they couldn't tell Virgin even though they can tell other providers. Virgin claim this is totally incorrect. They blamed one another at this point. I spent many hours on phone and chat with both companies dealing with this and eventually was assured by Vodafone that they would cover the almost 7 weeks of charges from Virgin as I had to take on a cancellation period before disconnection. When I finally got my closing bill from Virgin I contacted Vodafone via chat as agreed by the agent who said they would cover my losses. Eventually I had to switch to a phone call after I had been cut off from chat 3 times. When I got through on the phone the agent disputed that they had agreed to pay the accrued costs even though I had it screenshotted and he could see it on my account. I then was caught in a hellscape of trying to a) get them to understand that it is not my problem if their colleague has given out the wrong information and b) once he acknowledged that they should honour their word, trying to upload my final bill via a simultaneous chat as they don't do email?!!! I began this interaction at 11.30 am and as I type  at 3.23pm I am not yet done. Interspersed with some human comments are the inevitable AI generated generic comments which are beyond annoying. Oh, and at one point the agent asked me to have some patience and 'Wait!' said in what can only be described as an exasperated fashion. He also at one point offered me and then withdrew the offer of a ¬£10 voucher as I am not a mobile customer! Surely you can do better than this Vodafone. I am sorely disappointed that I am now contracted to you for 18 months as frankly you don't deserve the business.

Review: 19/05 - Dear Vodafone Customer Service,I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to express my dissatisfaction with the service I have been receiving since switching to Vodafone.Ten days ago, I transferred from Virgin to Vodafone due to Virgin‚Äôs inability to provide internet services for 17 days. Unfortunately, my experience with Vodafone has not been any better, as I have already encountered four outages in the past ten days.I have contacted your customer service five times, and the resolution offered has been inadequate, with the issue being attributed to CityFibre. While I understand that Vodafone uses CityFibre's network, my contract is with Vodafone, and I expect Vodafone to address and resolve these service disruptions promptly.The frequent outages have significantly impacted my daily activities and work, and I am seeking immediate action to rectify this situation. I would appreciate it if you could:Provide a clear explanation of the cause of these repeated outages.Offer a timeline for resolution.Compensate for the inconvenience suffered due to lack of consistent services.I have been paying Vodafone for reliable internet service, and I expect Vodafone to take responsibility for ensuring its provision, regardless of the third-party networks involved.Please treat this matter with urgency and let me know how you intend to resolve these issues.Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.Sincerely,19/05 7 hours latter Update: contacted the team as requested not only they gave the same responses as I had before but I wasted another 3 hours explaining everything over again! So it‚Äôs even worse than before20/05 NEW UPDATE - 30 hours and couting with no resolution and no internet. Vodafone are not willing to let me out of the contract withou paying Early Exit Fee but also is not giving me a sulution to my problem.

Review: I received an email nearly a week ago out of the blue telling me that I owed Vodafone money for equipment. I.e. an iPhone I purchased when I was a Vodafone broadband/mobile customer which I had been paying for and it turned out that I had accidentally cancelled the DD so I immediately tried to contact Vodafone by email asking them for details so I could either pay off any remaining balance in full or reset the DD. I since emailed them twice but absolutely no response! In the meantime I have received two threatening emails that unless I contacted they would pass it to a collection company. With that comes the problem with my credit reference file but clearly Vodafone don‚Äôt care! So Vodafone why the threatening emails? This could all have been resolved within minutes and the DD reset or the balance paid off but clearly you would rather make my life more difficult instead. Do your homework first about this company before using them as a supplier. 1600. 19.05,2025.  So Vodafone you are sorry for the experiences I have had from your company. So why are you not able to ‚Äúreach out‚Äù to me as you say I can? You have my number , you have my email address and you want to apologise so call me or email me and offer me some of that Customer Service you say was lacking and I am sure we can resolve this issue very quickly,

Review: Ordered broadband.  Couldn't fit due to rat chewing the fibre in a post. Fair enough so waited for it to be fixed got told 31st, then 3rd then 7th then 13th then 28th of May. Fair enough open reach could just do the work but reality is vodaphone just kept telling me the wrong dates for it to be fixed. I'm an ex telecoms engineer so I know the pole just needed capping at the top and a splice in the post... Hour work easy. Instead they are trying to request permission to change the whole post which means planning permission which takes months. I thought well give it time I get the ¬£6 compo / day. It'll be practically be free when doneHowever, then some smarty pants from vodaphone starts calling in the day, kindly told them I'm working nights, need to sleep call me back later I need sleep. Guy ignores this keeps yapping. I hung up then decided I'll just keep ringing even when I've picked the phone up I'm getting more calls from vodaphone.Now I've cancelled my broadband order and I'm going to cancel both mobile contracts next.Congrats. Maybe next time you'll let a man sleep. Not too sure why it asks for a location for Vodafone in York or Aberdeen when filling this in cause the issue was clearly in India.
Name: Tommy Lea

Review: I genuinely regret choosing Vodafone for both my broadband and mobile phone contract. I was sold their premium "Pro II Broadband" package on the promise of easy setup and expert support. None of it was delivered.The broadband never linked to my account, despite following every instruction. I tried to call for help ‚Äî only to discover that it‚Äôs not even possible to speak to a human being. I was forced to use a chatbot, which got me nowhere. Repeated requests for a callback were refused or ignored. Eventually, I was promised a call within the hour, and then a manager would follow up within 7 days. It‚Äôs now well past that, no one has ever called back.On top of that, I took out the mobile plan as part of a bundle which included a trade-in discount. I honestly described the phone, sent it in, and later received a vague text saying it was "not as described" ‚Äî with no explanation and the discount seemingly withdrawn.Most upsetting of all, I told Vodafone at the point of purchase that I had recently undergone brain surgery, and asked that communication be made slowly, verbally, and followed up in writing. I was assured this would be no problem. Instead, I have been fobbed off by automated systems, and nobody at Vodafone has made the slightest effort to respect the reasonable adjustments I requested, which they are legally required to make under the Equality Act.I‚Äôve sent multiple formal complaints, all ignored. No resolution. No apology. No service.This has been exhausting and completely unacceptable. I‚Äôm now escalating to CISAS (Vodafone‚Äôs dispute resolution scheme), but the time and energy this has cost me is not something I will soon forget.Avoid Vodafone at all costs, and if you do choose them, pray you never need support.PS Don't believe me, go look at any Facebook post and you will see a list of very unhappy customers trying to seek a resolution through other means, because they don't care about service!

My wife contacted them multiple times and explained to them she couldn't find a job and couldn't afford the bill, but they threatened her that if you don't pay the bill, it would be bad for your credit. Review: I went 128 days without broadband after moving house, despite Vodafone promising installation by the end of December. I was repeatedly given conflicting information, had to chase updates myself, and was even told my order had been cancelled without my consent.After two months of waiting, I was given a temporary WiFi dongle. The signal was poor due to my location, but I was told I wouldn‚Äôt be charged for it and would be refunded any fees. I‚Äôve now been charged ¬£77 for it, and when I tried to claim this back, Vodafone said they couldn‚Äôt find any record of that promise ‚Äì so I‚Äôm out of pocket on top of everything else.No one seemed to take ownership, and each time I contacted them, I had to start from scratch with a new adviser. I had to take time off work for missed appointments and even went into a store just to try and get answers.The delay was apparently due to Openreach needing to carry out work, but Vodafone didn‚Äôt manage this properly or communicate clearly. I finally got connected in May ‚Äì nearly four and a half months later ‚Äì but only after a long and stressful battle.Would not recommend if you‚Äôre relying on them for a time-sensitive move or expect to be treated fairly.

Review: I‚Äôve had a number of issues with Vodaphone since joining. Really slow Internet connection being the main issue. In April we lost all internet connection and spoke with someone who managed to fix the issue after 24 hours. Then we lost internet connection on another 3/4 occasions which took over 48 hours to fix and hundreds of conversations later just telling us to turn the power off, reset the box etc etc We asked on so many occasions for them to send an engineer out to fix the issue which they refused to do despite having no internet for days on end. Eventually we managed to get one sent out but that came with its own issues. Cancelling appointments, not turning up etc. when they did eventually come out it turns out everything was installed poorly and no wonder we kept losing internet connection. Fixed the issue and when I spoke to Vodaphone they tried telling me we are entitled to about ¬£9 compensation‚Ä¶ what a joke!!! After arguing to multiple people and getting the same results we have managed to get our April bill payment back (which would be applied  as a credit to use towards next bill) but guess what we haven‚Äôt even had that!!!!!!! Disgusting service

Review: Vodafone UK has the worst customer service I have ever experienced in my life. Since 14:00 today (and it‚Äôs now 21:45), I have been in contact with about 10 different Vodafone UK customer service representatives, both on the phone and via chat, and none of them has been able to help me.The simple issue is that no one can reach my number by phone ‚Äî no one is able to call me ‚Äî and nobody has been able to resolve or assist with this. When I was finally able to log into my Vodafone UK account (which was also a big hassle), I tried to upgrade my plan, hoping that might fix the issue of not being reachable. But when I attempted to upgrade, the message said: "This number is not able to upgrade" and "Can't upgrade with this number."None of the representatives could help me. Some of them even hung up on me for no reason, probably because the issue was too challenging to solve.On top of that, all of your services ‚Äî the website, chat, and app ‚Äî have major issues. It‚Äôs never clear if they‚Äôre working properly. For someone to suddenly become unreachable feels like a horror movie.All that was left was to get a PAC code, transfer my number to a different provider, and finally get the hell away from them.Never again, Vodafone UK.Best.
Name: Emilia

Review: Humerah was really nice and very helpful very lovely and relaxing experience

Review: Efficient handling of my pick up of the handset I bought online. Everyone was super polite and the guy who helped me, Rico was particularly good.

Review: I have been a Vodafone customer for many years and never had to complain until now.I recently took my phone into the Folkestone branch for repair to a broken screen, luckily it was still under warranty.They booked it in for repair and said I would get an email to confirm, and when it would be back .Vodafone carried out the repair,and sent my phone back to store via DHL delivery company.Unfortunately my phone never arrived back to the store,( I kept checking every day for 2 weeks)apparently it was "damaged in transit" according to DHL.The store manager Neil Price and store assistant Grant were very kind and helpful in trying to retrieve my phone, as I was extremely upset about it.Both guys were extremely helpful and did their very best to get my phone back, unfortunately without success.Their customer service went above and beyond, both going that extra mile to help me, in a very difficult situation.Neil Price & Grant Holden , you are both a credit to Vodafone.Thank you
Name: Kaz Alakazam

Review: I had a fantastic experience with Courtney at Vodafone when purchasing my new phone. She was friendly, knowledgeable, and genuinely focused on making sure I got the best deal for my needs. Courtney explained everything clearly, answered all my questions with patience, and made the whole process smooth and stress-free. Her customer service was outstanding, and she really went the extra mile. A credit to Vodafone ‚Äî thank you, Courtney!
Name: Sam Woodin

Review: Appalling Administration / Customer Service All ok until I tried to renew my contract. My engineer appointment was cancelled but I only discovered this a few days before, when I tried to find out why I'd had no confirmation. 3 MONTHS later, 1) I am out of contract, paying more for my broadband than I was quoted for an UPgraded service2) I am locked out of my account - neither my log in, or mobile number are 'recognised', despite a message being sent to this number every month3) I have wasted countless hours and suffered immense frustration at the dreadful AI / customer care teams who quote from a script with no understanding or means to do anything + a few advisors who were very helpful and assured me everything would be resolved but nothing actually happened. 4) A formal complaint has achieved nothing, yet I was asked today, for permission to close it.Update - the reply proves my point. I'd put my order number but I'm asked to contact facebook team to repeat everything I've already said by phone, email, chat and now an external review. Why not sort it / contact me directly?

Review: I am pleased to offer my highest recommendation for Mr. Jeffrey, who works at the Vodafone Arcade in Liverpool city center. During my interactions with him, I have consistently been impressed by his professionalism, in-depth knowledge of Vodafone products and services, and exceptional customer service skills.Mr. Jeffrey is not only courteous and approachable, but he also takes the time to understand customer needs and provides clear, effective solutions with patience and expertise. His ability to stay calm under pressure and handle multiple customers with ease reflects his strong communication skills and dedication to delivering excellent service.Whether assisting with complex technical issues or providing advice on suitable plans and devices, Mr. Jeffrey goes above and beyond to ensure customer satisfaction. His positive attitude and genuine care for his work make him a valuable asset to the Vodafone team.I confidently recommend Mr. Jeffrey for any position or recognition that values dedication, competence, and outstanding customer service.Sincerely,Shamika Kaushalya

Review: I don‚Äôt even know where to start with how terrible Vodafone‚Äôs service has been ‚Äì both in-store and over the phone. I was pre-approved for two contracts, even though I only needed one. The store staff were completely unhelpful, uninterested, and ignored me throughout the process. I ordered an iPhone 16 Pro and a Microsoft Surface Pro laptop. They gave me the phone in-store and said the laptop would be delivered.On the delivery day, I was at home the entire time. The DPD driver didn‚Äôt even knock ‚Äì instead, they marked it as ‚Äúincorrect pin‚Äù . When I called Vodafone to get it redelivered, they pushed me to DPD. DPD said they can‚Äôt redeliver and that it‚Äôs going back to the warehouse.So who do I believe? DPD says it‚Äôs still in transit. Vodafone says it‚Äôs already out of stock. Then Vodafone says, ‚ÄúSince you passed the credit check, we‚Äôll give you another device.‚Äù I waited for laptop to get restocked. Then later after months I asked for a Samsung Fold phone instead ‚Äî now suddenly I‚Äôm not eligible anymore? Why pre-approve two contracts and promise a replacement if that‚Äôs not true?And here‚Äôs the real problem ‚Äî Vodafone just tells you anything to get you off the line. They give you completely false information. Every agent has a different story. One says a complaint has been raised. Another says no record of any complaint. One says I won‚Äôt be charged. Another says I owe a payment. It‚Äôs all lies just to make you stop calling. No one takes responsibility.To top it off, I paid ¬£100 upfront for the laptop. They said the contract was cancelled and I wouldn‚Äôt be charged. But I was charged for one month and received payment reminder messages. It took TWO MONTHS and constant follow-ups just to get my upfront fee refunded. And that only happened because I kept chasing them ‚Äî not because Vodafone did their job.Vodafone, your customer service is beyond disgraceful. You treat customers with zero respect. This has been the most frustrating experience I‚Äôve ever had with any company. I‚Äôll never use Vodafone again, and I would strongly advise anyone reading this: don‚Äôt fall for their lies. They‚Äôll promise you everything and deliver nothing
Name: B.Prashanthi Reddy

Review: I have been a customer with Vodafone for over 20 yrs for my mobile phone and still am , have also been with their home broadband for 7 years , there have been issues but generally ok , the call centres can be problematic due to language barriers , as they are all based abroad in either Egypt or India , they try but often not easy due to accents etc .Today I have terminated my new contract for full fibre broadband due to the atrocious mix up , they told me they would price match any other advertised deal available ( in my case Gigaclear offering 500mbps for 24 a month ) as I have my mobile with them I get a Vodafone together discount of ¬£2 plus the max discount they could offer is ¬£9 ‚Ä¶which brought it down to ¬£33 ‚Ä¶they then said they would credit my account for the remaining amount to bring it down to ¬£24 a month ‚Ä¶however this was all done VERBALLY and when the contract arrived I was being charged ¬£33 which isn‚Äôt what was agreed . ‚Ä¶bearing in mind I spent a whole hour on the phone dealing with this . I was promised a call back which never happened , so have no cancelled which is a shame as I prefer to stay with the same company and avoid the hassle of moving ‚Ä¶but I am now signing up with Gigaclear ‚Ä¶so bye bye Vodafone , you‚Äôve lost a good customer ‚Ä¶and when my mobile phone contract runs out in September I shall go with another company . Review: I‚Äôve had a terrible experience with Vodafone. I called on 29 April to relocate my broadband service to my new flat. The agent told me it would be set up by 6 May, which felt like a long wait, but I accepted it. As the date approached, I was notified that the installation had been rescheduled to 9 May. I took a day off work to accommodate this.On 9 May, the technician arrived but was unable to complete the job due to missing tools, and I was told it would be rescheduled again to 13 May. I reluctantly agreed, as I urgently need the internet.On 13 May, I took another day off and waited the whole day for the technician. I then received a notification saying I had been "missed" ‚Äî despite being home all day and available. I tried to call, but there was no contact number provided, and I received no prior communication to confirm the technician‚Äôs arrival.This is extremely frustrating and unprofessional. After all these delays and poor service, I‚Äôve decided to cancel my Vodafone account and will be switching to a more reliable provider.I would not recommend Vodafone to anyone based on my experience.

Review: Rubbish service. Words fail me.1) Website crashed when I chose the 'Add plan' option to try to see my option to buy a SIM-only plan with an 'exclusive discount. Gave up trying and went over to the chat;2) After slogging through the time-wasting chatbot options I eventually got to chatting with a human being. Agent just went into listing what she wanted to sell me instead of listening to my requirements. Gave up on the chat;3) Got a phone call from the same agent to try and salvage the situation. Got a very bad VoIP line from India (agent had very heavy Indian accent). The bad line and heavy accent made it nearly impossible  but eventually I got a SIM-only deal for ¬£8.33+VAT / month for 18 months. It had taken 2 failed attempts and an hour of my time so far;4) Next day got a 'Welcome' email saying the contract was for ¬£20+VAT per month. Called Vodafone to get a correction. Got an agent with a really heavy Eastern European accent who just told me I had 3 options - cancel the contract and restart with a new price, wait until next billing cycle to sort it out, and another irrelevant option. Had to argue really hard that Vodafone had already agreed to the ¬£8.33+VAT and it was their job to confirm the correct price by checking their audit trail - it was not my job to fix their quality control problems;4) Agent mentioned a ¬£14 discount, then it clicked that the original welcome email had bad HTML in it that rendered the '¬£' sign as something out of a Space Invaders game so the info about the discount was just gobbledygook but also buried as an after-thought at the bottom of the message. More to the point they should have stated clearly what I am paying and not the price before discount. Simple. Another 30 mins. wasted;Vodafone are a basket case.- website doesn't work;- webchat is a time-waster with agents badly trained;- atrocious overseas voice connections to call-centre agents;- use of call-centre agents with unacceptable English skills;- failure to check outbound emails for accuracy and legibility;- agents are programmed to provide the responses that Vodafone want to give instead of what the customer needs as though we exist for their benefit;

Review: I opened a Broadband Account in December 2024 but decided that I didn't want to proceed with it and cancelled with Vodafone within the 14 day cooling off period.  Even though I received the router I never opened the box or used the service.  There is a Vodafone store where I live so I returned the equipment and was told the account was closed.. WRONG.In January I received a missed payment letter.  I called Vodafone and they said it was an error and not to worry they will close the account. I then received a missed payment letter in February.  I went back to the store (when I called the Call centre they could not access the account) and they agreed the account should be closed and again told me it had been sorted out. I then received a credit report which was showing missed payments thus affecting my credit score. When I disputed these so-called missing payments these were showing as cleared but now I have April and May showing as missed.  How can anyone trust Vodafone to provide a decent service when they cannot get a simple matter of closing an account right!

Review: Vodafone has serious network problems in multiple locations.  Experiencing mobile data speeds on my iPhone 14 of 0.88 Mbps download and 0.30 Mbps upload - EE speeds where I am are 136 Mbps download on the same device and Vodafone are being cheeky saying it‚Äôs my phone that‚Äôs broken and not their terrible network. Had to cancel the wife‚Äôs sim as a second line as she had the same problem (within 14 days cooling off period). Problem at multiple locations over a wide area.  Vodafone seem to have had no 4G Coverage (and they won‚Äôt deploy it and same for 5G in some areas) and what‚Äôs been happening is the phones have been using 3G which is in the process of being turned off.  If it‚Äôs not a very busy area there‚Äôs no 5G so you receive the lowest possible speeds less than 1 Mbps (less than 128 kilobyte download speeds)Phone swaps between 1 bar and network unavailable at times where as I have a good signal on the second sim with EE (business use only).  No matter how much I complain to Vodafone they don‚Äôt want to help and they repeatedly ask me to do various things to reset network settings even though it‚Äôs their awful network. EDIT; they don‚Äôt care. Broadband is the wrong team.  I‚Äôve already asked for it to be raised as a complaint but they‚Äôve not done so please sort this out.  It‚Äôs horrendous the problems I‚Äôm facing its data speed it‚Äôs noise on the line and problems sending text messages because of the very weak signal where I live.  There‚Äôs also problems at multiple addresses /locations even far from home.

Review: Internet connection is actually diabolical with being bellow guaranteed minimum speeds 40 odd days now since signing up to them, barely ever works on my games consoles and the price is way to high for the service actually getting as I have constant issues with Internet being barely 1Mbps. Lets get on about there customer service.. its actually a joke being run round and round in circles with the same test and the same questions over and over blaming everything but them selves. Was even told that I was only going to get 100mbps with the cable being used from the box in the wall and told me the 'speed i was getting' was 102mbps when actually I was getting 750mpbs so was straight out lied to. I've had better Internet on dial up! Stay away from vodafones apparent full fiber. Its full crap!!! I will be changing with immediate effect as they have now breached contract with 36 registered speed tests being under minimum guaranteed and nothing being done about it after constantly complaints and requesting an engineer visit. Would not even recommend you if you were the last ISP on earth!!

Review: Initially requested an upgrade to full fibre 3 months ago, was given an installation date and then nothing happened. When I contacted them they said their operative had cancelled it (no warning given). SO went thru the process again, was eventually fitted (after several weeks, road and garden being dug up by openreach and finally fibre installed by another sub-contractor).Never received a new 'powerhub' as promised. Now their is good wifi speed but only within a few feet of the old router. Contacted them to explain and request a replacement and after over an hour of pointless checks, tests and hanging around waiting for their operative to reply have been fobbed off with the 'everything is fine, there is no problem' routine. Abysmal customer service. Now I have the joy of trying to get through to them on the phone to cancel the contract.Vodafone - simply not worth the hassle!

Review: We have used Vodafone home broadband since October 2024 and have always had a cut-off issue a couple of times per day. I lost track of how many times I called customer service about this. The support guys were great. Always did their best to help, but nothing has changed. 1 day good, the day after very poor connection. I begged them to change the device, maybe it is faulty, or send an engineer to check, but they said the line seems okay, and they cannot do that. My husband and I work from home and today we could not complete our tasks and missed our SLAs! onlye because of the bad internet connection. Congratulations, Vodafone, and thank you for not helping me with this situation. This is your fault, your connection issue, and you asked me to pay the early cancellation fee of around ¬£300 instead of having a professional conversation from custoemr success. I am just told a formal complaint form has been raised and you will reach me out. I will not be your customer from the 15th, and because you see it on your system, you probably will reach out on the 16th and say " there is nothing you can do because I cancelled my contract" I know this scenario. Huuuugeee disappointment. You always had bad network connections check how many times i reached you out. You never manage to fix it permanately and in the end you forced me to pay early termination fee. I terminated my contract with you today due to poor connections, which is your responsibility, and I received an email that you said that an estimated ¬£300 something will be added to my final bill. Speechless! I will also change my mobile contract, but unfortunately, I need to wait until the end because otherwise, you will charge me for another ¬£300. Never say never, but NEVER get your broadband ( City fibre) I mentally felt down, spent hours on the phone, missed my SLAs and now I need to work more to close the gap instead of spending time with my child. Thank you for that! Well done. Just pay a bit more and go with more pro home broadband brands. They do not care who you are or how struggle you are.

Review: For broadband- we booked our move to take Vodafone with us to our new property on 11th March (moving date of 31st March). They came out to us on the 2nd April to fit the connection but was unable to do so due to external works needing to be completed. They said someone would be back out within 2-5 working days. After weeks of chasing and a lot of stress (whilst being heavily pregnant) they eventually came back out to do the external work on 7th May (over a month later). The connection still didn‚Äôt go live so we were told an engineer would come out and it would be live by midnight on 9th May. We are now on the 13th May and were promised a technician out today between 8am- 1pm. They haven‚Äôt turned up. For context, they are aware I‚Äôm over 37 weeks pregnant and don‚Äôt have any access to internet or signal meaning I am unable to contact anyone in an emergency. We are paying ¬£25 a month for a 5G dongle to try and get some form of internet through Vodafone which also doesn‚Äôt work and they‚Äôve not once offered to pay to compensate this. Due to working from home, I have had to fund and organise alternative travel and working arrangements for the last month and a half. Today they are still telling us they don‚Äôt know when the technician will be out and that it could be tomorrow or longer. I have been promised call backs from managers and they haven‚Äôt called. I have had to call to chase every few days. Do not trust if they tell you someone will call you or be out to your property as it doesn‚Äôt go ahead. The stress of this is causing me to be seriously unwell. They are a shocking company with no organisation or ability to talk successfully between teams. Do not trust what they say as we have been told so many lies since the start of April. As soon as we receive the compensation owed we will be changing provider. We‚Äôve only been with them since the start of the year and haven‚Äôt had internet for half the time. Will be going back to Sky.

Review: Absolutely baffled by Vodafone's upgrade policy. I've been a paying customer, never missed a bill, and now that I‚Äôm eligible for an upgrade, they‚Äôve declined it after a fresh credit check? Excuse me? What other network does that? I was previously with O2, and if you paid off your device, you could upgrade freely‚Äîno ridiculous hoops to jump through and certainly no invasive credit checks just to give them more money.Vodafone, you might want to rethink your priorities. Alienating loyal, creditworthy customers over something as petty and nonsensical as a credit check for an upgrade is how you lose people. It's not 2009 anymore‚Äîusers have options, and I, for one, will be exploring every single one of them. You‚Äôve officially made it to the list of ‚Äúnetworks to avoid at all costs.‚ÄùUnbelievable.
