Review: I‚Äôm so disappointed to have to write this review, especially as I have been a LOYAL Vodafone customer for around THIRTY YEARS, but sadly the treatment that I have received recently has left me no option.To cut a very long story as short as possible, I had been querying my bills for around 10 months as they were ridiculously high and I was passed from pillar to post and eventually I received a call from someone called Reece who is a case handler in their Specialist Care team, who spent a lot of time going through everything with me and he found that I was correct and I had been paying for something which I didn‚Äôt have and the long and short of it was that Vodafone owed me just over ¬£1,500 and an apology !!! Reece was very nice and he did apologise and was also able to remove the bad credit reference had been put on my file.He advised me that the money would be in my account within 10 working days. 10 working days came and went, still no money. I contacted Reece again and this time was told that an error had been made and he had requested the amount of ¬£15,500 to be refunded to me and that had obviously been refused. He admitted that he had made a mistake and confirmed that the next BACS payment roll would be done on the 21st April. Once again no money was received. I again emailed Reece, who had now stopped responding and someone called Mohammed replied saying I had to wait a further 10 working days. I explained that this really was not acceptable and I had been caused enough stress by Vodafone. I have previously suffered a stroke and when I tried to speak to someone this morning, the first call handler was so unhelpful and initially told me I wasn‚Äôt the account holder !!! I have asked if there is any way in which this payment can be made to me sooner. We are not in the 1970‚Äôs and we all know that a payment can be made by the click of button, however, Vodafone don‚Äôt have this option. I‚Äôm sure if I owed Vodafone this money, I would have been cut off by now.I did ask if he could please contact the so called ‚Äúback office‚Äù, which is where the payment is made from and explain the following:A LOYAL 30 year customer was overcharged and it has taken 10 months to resolve this.A LOYAL 30 year customer had a bad mark put on her credit file.A LOYAL 30 year customer was supposed to have her refund of over ¬£1,500 refunded to her by the 15th April but Vodafone made a mistake and put it through as ¬£15,000 so it was refused. A LOYAL 30 year customer will potentially have waited 20 working days for a refund which they are entitled to. However, he said he wasn‚Äôt able to do this and no one could contact the ‚Äúback office‚Äù, which I don‚Äôt believe. So, basically there is nothing I can do but sit and wait a further 10 working days, making it a total of 20 working days for Vodafone to refund money they owe me, and to be honest I‚Äôm not even confident that the payment will be made. I have lost all faith in VodafoneI haven‚Äôt asked for compensation or anything, just what is rightfully mine.  I currently have 5 lines with Vodafone, and will be changing providers, because if this is how they treat a customer who has been loyal to them for nearly 30 years, I dread to think how they will treat others. Complaint Reference: 131942729My response to Vodafone‚Äôs comment below. Who would you like me to reach out to because apparently the only people who can help are the so called ‚Äúback room team‚Äù are not contactable ?

Review: Vodafone has caused me so much stress over the years I‚Äôve been on contract with them. First of all, they had troubles taking out my direct debit so i was consistently getting charged for late payment fees, funny how that came out of my account just fine! It messed up my credit score when it wasn‚Äôt my fault.Then, I cancelled the direct debit and began to pay manually each month through the app. The app would glitch and wouldn‚Äôt allow me to view the ‚ÄúMy Billing‚Äù section, which caused more stress when paying my bill every month! Then, I finally cancelled the contract and had one more bill to pay. I informed the agent on the phone that I would be leaving the country and travelling for four months. During this time, I was unable to access the Vodafone App to pay my bill, because it would send a code to my old number, which had now been cancelled and was no longer receiving texts or calls. I couldn‚Äôt pay via the phone because I‚Äôm in a foreign country. Finally, I was able to figure out how to pay my final bill. But the stress is still not over! Vodafone is charging me ¬£5 for a late payment fee from that final bill. And I‚Äôm having the same issue, unable to pay it via the app or via the phone. Every time I call and receive help from an agent, it is VERY RARE that i actually have the problem solved. I feel genuine excitement for when I finally pay vodafone and i will no longer be contracted to them! It will be such a relief!I have wasted SO MUCH money to Vodafone. I would NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE !!!!!!
Name: Sophie Anna

Review: I‚Äôve had an appalling experience with Vodafone, and I can confidently say this is the worst service I have ever encountered.For over a month now, my internet has been extremely unreliable, going down multiple times a day everyday, for over an hour at times. Despite spending over 10 hours on the phone with customer support, I have yet to see any resolution.I have additional needs flagged on my account, but this seems to make no difference whatsoever. Vodafone's customer service, internal processes, communication, and technical support have been nothing short of chaotic.I‚Äôve been passed between multiple teams, given false information, and even told that the constant disconnections were "healthy." I‚Äôve gone through the same troubleshooting steps numerous times, repeating myself over and over, yet the company is unwilling to acknowledge any fault.Meanwhile, I‚Äôm still expected to pay for this unreliable service, and when I mentioned leaving, I was met with passive-aggressive readings of my contract and that I will have to pay to exit the contract. I‚Äôve fulfilled my obligations by paying for the service, yet the service itself doesn‚Äôt work, and I‚Äôm being made to feel like the one at fault.I was even told to contact City Fibre, despite them having already visited on behalf of Vodafone and confirming the connection was fine. My contract is with Vodafone, not City Fibre, and they should be sorting this out, not passing the responsibility elsewhere.I‚Äôve been promised multiple callbacks, but rarely have they materialised. Additionally, Vodafone is aware that I have no signal in my area and rely on WiFi calling, yet when I left my home with my young baby to call them, they refused to speak with me any further after spening 35 minutes talking to me, citing that I needed to be at home (even though I can‚Äôt make calls without WiFi). I have also been asked to use my own ethernet cable (at my cost) - i had to ask on a separate call for them to send me another one of their own, rather than being forthcoming about it. I am also now paying for EE WiFi available in my area in order to work as I cannot rely on Vodafone. Again, all at my costs. I have lost work time (as I work from home) as well as losing my hard earned money to pay for EE's public WiFi. All the while still paying Vodafone for their appalling internet service. Vodafone have never even offered any sort of compensation or reimbursement for their lack of service. I have even mentioned it but their staff are bound by strict rules where they can't actually serve their customers.There are many more examples of poor service I could mention, but frankly, I‚Äôm exhausted from repeating myself on multiple daily calls to Vodafone.It feels like I‚Äôm being scammed, and I‚Äôm left wondering at what point Vodafone will acknowledge their fault and breach of contract. I have over a month‚Äôs worth of evidence showing the service being down repeatedly, yet I‚Äôm still being charged and feel like I am being threatened with exit fees. It‚Äôs a clear example of a large corporation exploiting its customers, and it‚Äôs disgraceful.I strongly urge anyone to avoid Vodafone at all costs.P.S. the Internet went down during this review - so I had to write it all again. UPDATE:THEY NOW WON'T LET ME LEAVE WITHOUT EXIT FEES AFTER SAYING IF I WAS NOT HAPPY I COULD. DISGRACEFUL. I HAVE A BABY WITH ADDITIONAL NEEDS AND VODAFONE ONLY CARE ABOUT THEIR GREED - NOT THE CUSTOMER. I HAVE HAD TO MAKE YET ANOTHER PHONE CALL WHERE I HAVE HAD TO RESET THE ROUTER. BUNCH OF LIARS AND PEOPLE WITH FALSE PROMISES. NEXT STEP OFCOM. ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING.

Review: What‚Äôs the point of promoting deals through affiliates if you‚Äôre not willing to honour them, especially when your website is clearly faulty? I‚Äôve tried twice now ‚Äì once today and once last week ‚Äì to sign up for a SIM-only and Broadband offer via TopCashback. Each time, I get all the way to the final page to submit the order, only to be hit with an error saying there‚Äôs something wrong with my details, without explaining what exactly.I called customer service and spent 30 minutes speaking to a representative who kept repeating that nothing could be done, and that they can‚Äôt process special offers over the phone. When I asked to speak to technical support or anyone who might actually help, I was told no such team exists. I also tried the online chat twice, but the agents were dismissive and uninterested. I practically had to beg for assistance, even though I found others online mentioning the same error ‚Äì still with no solution!The webchat team didn‚Äôt just refuse to help with sales ‚Äì they refused to help at all.	‚Ä¢	Can you connect me to someone who can explain the problem? NO.	‚Ä¢	Can you match the deal? NO.	‚Ä¢	Can I escalate this? NO.	‚Ä¢	Is there anything you can do? NO.Frankly, it‚Äôs insulting. The complete lack of care, accountability, and willingness to assist is unbelievable ‚Äì and I‚Äôm not even your customer yet! Based on this experience, it‚Äôs clear to me that Vodafone has no interest in gaining new customers.

Review: This has been hands down the worst activation experience I've had for switching broadband. Signed up on the 6th March which involved openreach having to install a new box. Raised some questions about the work needed which never got answered by openreach and Vodafone were no better. Had 7 calls with Vodafone about the status and each time I had to explain to them that I'm waiting on openreach to answer my questions. Each time Vodafone said they would chase and update me but they never did. Had my activation date pushed back even though the initial date was 5 weeks after sign up. The long delay has caused my current contract to run out and my monthly fee to nearly triple. I was hoping to avoid this by switching in time. Vodafone have not offered any compensation for the issues that I've had. In the end my activation was cancelled because Vodafone couldn't communicate with openreach properly. Review: I switched away from Vodafone over a month ago, yet I‚Äôm still being billed for a service that should have been cancelled. I‚Äôve tried multiple times to resolve this via live chat, but the experience has been nothing short of frustrating‚Äîagents either cut the chat without resolving anything or give vague, dismissive responses.I‚Äôm now being charged over ¬£50 for something I shouldn‚Äôt be paying for, and I‚Äôve been told I‚Äôll be charged again due to a 30-day notice period‚Äîeven though the delay is entirely due to Vodafone‚Äôs own failure to process the cancellation properly.It's impossible to get proper help or accountability from anyone. The lack of communication and basic customer care is shocking for a company of this size.Avoid Vodafone if you value your time, money, or sanity. Switching away is hard enough‚Äîbeing charged after you leave is just insulting.Update: The live chat experience has been incredibly frustrating. Replies are painfully slow, with long periods of silence (20 minutes for 1 reply) and no updates. Even worse, agents ask irrelevant questions, like ‚ÄúIs this about your broadband?‚Äù when I‚Äôve already clearly said multiple times that I‚Äôm making a complaint about my broadband. It feels like no one‚Äôs actually reading the messages.This just adds to the sense that Vodafone‚Äôs support is disorganised and dismissive. It's exhausting trying to resolve even a simple issue.

Review: Thankfully Vodafone still employ HUMANS! I had survived days of disruption whilst upgrading my plan, (¬£!) router AND mobile! Alexa was suffering withdrawal systems as was I, my Ring security cameras, tv‚Äôs and calls. I was even reduced to raising my voice to a robot, demanding to speak to a human in response to: ‚ÄòI‚Äôm afraid I didn‚Äôt catch that‚Äô etc etc! Sleepless nights dreading the ‚Äòinevitable‚Äô loss of data whilst transferring from my -ancient battery -failing -iPhone to the new all singing and dancing 16e!I was not best pleased to have been provided with the new phone but no means of powering it up as the cable supplied was not compatible to connect to the house 3 pin plug! More delay, more expense and then a new case and the latterly advised ¬£25 in store transfer cost!In Worcester I arrived early as advised and sat with Tom. At first I thought he might be a nerd facing a non techie very old  failure! A meeting of 2 different worlds!?However he did recover his empathy and I was delighted because the transfer was completed much earlier than I had expected and he reassured me that nothing would or had been lost and sensing ‚Äòmy journey‚Äô had been long he said, smiling, he would not charge me!! üòä Tom: You ‚Äòdone good‚Äô ‚öΩÔ∏è!Relax , there is a life after the days of dread of changing all systems. Also MANY thanks to the humans employed by Vodafone in Egypt, Northern Ireland and South Africa, all were very supportive and helpful whilst explaining a different language!! Improvements?Start the contract once the new kit has been received and installed not instantly on sales negotiation ?Availability of a basic tutorial would have been good as the 16e is totally different to my iPhone 8!Maybe Apple could/ should have supplied a typical UK three pin plug connection ?

Review: Quick reply to the replyLOL- call us, almost impossible to get someone with any understanding of the company on the actual phone. You get outsourced support via chat that are helping 20 people at once, clearly, and know nothing about the company   I‚Äôve wasted a combined two working weeks minimum calling or chatting them.  Yesterday I chatted with an agent about returning the extra equipment and it was 43 minutes - they couldn‚Äôt tell me anything. I asked one question - tell me the serials or MAC addresses if the provisioned equipment, they wanted me to explain why I needed that info, then to go through a FOURTH security check. So, that‚Äôs going in a landfill sadly - they clearly have no record of sending it to me. Why should I care. ‚ÄîSwitched broadband. They sent me two modems, never arranged for the non provisioned. I lost 18% of my speed when I switched from BT. Told them there was a problem, in fact what it was (as a highly technical 30 year professional) - they argued, 8 months later they rewired when someone new moved in, speed fixed. The mobile signal connects almost nowhere in London.  Even if it says it is, it‚Äôs not. Trying to break the contract for failure to provide service. Their answer, report the issue when you‚Äôre in the spot that‚Äôs not working ‚Ä¶. How?!?!  Alternately, they want me resetting mobile settings on my phone whenever I change areas.  They just don‚Äôt have a clue. Their customer service is awful, they have terrible coverage, their broadband is weaker than the competition even using the same lines.  They don‚Äôt listen.  They don‚Äôt try to I absolutely HATE this company.  I can‚Äôt wait to move every service in November. Don‚Äôt be tempted by switch pricing. They‚Äôre the absolute worst.

Review: My broadband was installed by Open Reach on 3 April. Review: Let me start by saying that I have Vodafone broadband and have, fortunately, never had an issue. For this reason I recommended this company to my parents. How I wish I had not!The issue started with the new broadband not seeming to function on the day it was meant to go live. Fortunately I was at my parents house visiting on that day so was able to make "first contact" with Vodafone supposed customer service department. I spent over an hour on the line to the advisor videoing the setup of both the existing fibre inlet box and the router, changing cables, at the insistence of the advisor, and providing serial numbers of both units, requiring the movement of various pieces of furniture and inconveniencing my parents. After all this I was asked to send further pictures to an email address and that the advisor would get back to my parents between 8 and 9:30am the following morning as I explained that they had a hospital appointment that required them to leave home at 10am. Come the following day no phone call was received and I had to contact Vodafone again at approximately 2pm as the broadband was still not working and the promised phone call had not materialised! My brother, who is in IT, had then to make an unscheduled journey away from his work to see if he could assist. He received exactly the same instructions I had received and spent a similar amount on the line to an advisor despite telling this advisor that we had been through all this previously. I have copied below the email he sent to Vodafone on Thursday 17th April that explains his frustrations:"Please find attached photos as requested.¬† We've also attached a copy of the syslog from the router, which suggests that the route date and time are incorrect, set to 2023.I'm very angry that this issue is still ongoing, and its been almost a week now and the support we've got has been very poor and disappointing, you seem hung up on us providing photos although to me it's clear the issue isn't on our side or with the OpenReach connectivity!  You keep on insisting that we provide you photos of the light status, although my mother (over 75) spent over an hour on a video call on both Monday and Wednesday and had to move furniture so she could show you the lights on the router and OpenReach portal and we've told you the status of these lights several times, and you even took screenshots of them whilst on the calls.  The issue is clearly not on our side, the OpenReach connectivity was working prior to the change over, the lights (as we keep informing you) are displaying that connectivity is working and the cabling is set correctly up.   The fact you've seen the status of the lights and we've demonstrated and told you their status, I don't understand why this isn't good enough for you and why you've not been taking the issue seriously.  My mother and father are both vulnerable people, and need their phone/internet so they're in contact with their doctors and the hospital, as my dad has needed a pre-op this week and an operation scheduled for next week, so needs to be in daily contact with his doctors and hospital and this has not been possible since Monday. We have attempted to send the photos on several occasions but we were provided the wrong email address, hbbexperts, rather than hbbxperts and even after we confirmed it on the support calls we had nobody on your side spotted the fact that the "E" wasn't required or emphasised that the "E" wasn't necessary.  The only way we identified the issue was when a text message was sent to my mother with the correct email address in it.  Can I suggest that you set up an additional email address so  that emails sent to hbbexperts are forwarded to hbbxperts, as this would seem a simple way to resolve this understandable confusion and/or send a confirmation text message with the email address clearly provided in it. The fact that you've left two elderly vulnerable people with out access to a phone/internet isn't good enough and after almost a week you've still haven't identified the fault or made any progress in resolving this, I think that this needs to be prioritised and resolved as a matter of urgency! "He was instructed to go buy a new LAN cable, despite the fact that we had already tried the supplied cable and a spare cable. Needless to say the new cable made no difference. From this you would think that your advisors would surmise that the issue was not the cable having tried three separate cables, including two band new ones. But the next communication is to tell my parents you have dispatched a new cable! As Albert Einstein said ‚ÄúInsanity is doing the same thing over and over and expecting different results‚ÄùTHIS IS TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE, ELDERLY VUNERABLE PEOPLE LEFT WITHOUT PHONE OR BROADBAND FOR AT OVER A WEEK WITH NO HELP AND MASSIVE INCONVIENCE AND ADDITIONAL COST!

Review: It took me about 3 minutes to get here and leave this review so it should show you how crap the mobile data is.I don't care about excellent customer service when the service itself is crap.People are delusional. 4.6? A joke, morons.The mobile data is atrocious, I live in Nottingham, not an isolated area, it's Friday morning and the data is absolute crap. 10-15 Mbps and I pay for the unlimited Mbps package.80% of the time the mobile data is 10, sometimes 20 Mbps. At night, when most people sleep, it's 200-250 Mbps.For what, morons?And I thought Three was crap. I left them for Vodafone. Review: Spending an hour repeating myself, security questions (interminable), and being asked to confirm via video which lights were on my router (to confirm the same ones I'd already reported, because I am not partially sighted), left me frustrated. Coupled with the call technician being very tricky to understand, and being told on repeat that he was checking if there were other complaints of outages (we kept telling him there were not), he threw the mother of all curve balls in. You must stay on the line, I am trying to get hold of City Fibre. Why must I stay on the line? To keep the ticket open - kept on hold - no! He finally agreed to call me back within 2-3hrs. 2hrs later he kindly called. He was polite.However, he had not managed to contact City Fibre - but he will call me back tomorrow between 4-6pm with an update! This is ridiculous. I have no Internet. I work. I need the Internet specifically for a role I do, which will not hold up to a Hotspot. He told me not to worry, I would receive a token compensatory sum once I have been without Internet for 48hrs. Umm, but I can't do my job tomorrow Vodafone, and will be out of pocket. We evidently need an Engineer, and not another round of pointless phone calls telling me you can't get hold City Fibre. We have also persistently not had the minimum guaranteed speeds over the past 6wks we've been with them. So, no, I would NOT recommend Vodafone. Indeed I would avoid like the plague! And before I receive the rote response of 'do contact our customer service,' no need. I will be raising a formal complaint and will need to find a more reliable, and dependable service provider.

Review: I switched my Broadband to Vodaphone, what a mistake, take this as a word of warning!!I rang the company as the B/B wouldn't even reach my son's bedroom at the top of the stairs.....I was told to upgrade further or tough luck? The speeds weren't great, so I decided to cancel within my 14 day cooling off period, this is where the problems really started. If you fancy spending hours on the phone, explaining the same problems over and over again to a call-centre in a far away galaxy, then this is the company for you. Not only that, they will throw in talking over the top of you and being what I construe as rudeness....The cherry on the top, was when they left me for over a week with no broadband, delighted I was, with a Daughter at University and Son revising for GCSE's....this one switch thing worked well.I wouldn't mind so much if I hadn't been constantly lied to and reassured that I wouldn't be cut off, but hey-ho, you live and learn....and I've learned that I will never deal with such a bunch of incompetent buffoons, ever again. If you want the "Vodaphone Experience" sign on the dotted line, it's an emotional rollercoster, of which you will want to get off, sharpish....Be warned good people. Ps. I am not normally a review sort of person, but felt compelled on this occasion.

Review: Vodafone Broadband - Switch from BT.  Was reluctant to switch provider but the savings were significant.  Was given a great deal of reassurance that the switchover would be smooth and there would be no difference.  This is true with regards to the broadband but not true with regards to digital voice/VOIP. BT Digital Voice comes with a 'Digital Voice Adapter' which enables a landline phone base to be in a new location away from the router, in our case the base has the voicemail function to playback etc so has to be accessible.  After a call with Vodafone I have been told that they do not supply a similar product and on further research certain access keys have to be requested from Vodafone and then other equipment configured for access.  Way beyond me and I would think most people. In Summary Broadband great, Digital Voice in our case not a comparable service and will look to see if we can revert back to BT.

Review: I went in to the Vodafone store two weeks ago as I had lost all signal to my phone and no data worked. I visited again today with the issue still not resolved and no one on the phone or online chat was helpful and no one could diagnose the issue. Rob sat with me today for over an hour to fix the issue. I have now restarted my phone after only leaving a few hours ago and it is working. Rob was incredibly friendly, chatty and polite and was a pleasure to talk to. His colleague was also super helpful and friendly however I didn‚Äôt catch his name. They even charged my phone for me while in store so it didn‚Äôt die after I left. 10/10 experience very good service and people!

Review: Several months ago, after having had lousy service from Virgin I decided to try vodafone, more expensive but I thought it would be better and a bit faster.A few weeks after signing up I had a visit from a vodafone surveyor who informed me that the openreach fibre didn't come to my house so they would have to investigate if and when it would be available.So I contacted openreach who told me that the full fibre was available at my home, so someone from either vodafone or openreach isn't telling the truth.I then heard nothing for a while but finally got a message saying things were going ok.Today I got a text giving me a phone number - 08080034515 - but when I rang it I was told that I would have to use their online chat at vodafone.co.uk.chatonline - but this website either doesn't exist or can't be reached as it timed out using 3 separate browsers.I then tried their website that tells you to use a chatbot called 'tobi' - which is probably short for totally obsolete and incompetent bot.I then rang them and after going through security I had to wait - after about 10 minutes of silence I terminated the call.They then called me back and I had to go through security yet again, only to be told that there are 'delays' getting a service too my home. They could have sent a text or an email or just told me without all the security and waiting.So I've cancelled the installation, Virgin might be bad but at least they can communicate without wasting an hour of my life.BT broadband using full fibre from openreach is used by several people just a few yards from my home and BT and EE have also confirmed that full fibre is available at my home right now with speeds up to 1.6Gbps so vodafone are talking total rubbish.UPDATE - about an hour after writing this I went outside and there 50 yards down the road was an Openreach team with their manhole open - so I asked them if the fibre went to the end of the road where I live on my side of the road and they confirmed that it does.So thanks Vodafone, I've found out just how incompetent you are without having to use your services for a few years!UPDATE 2 - the links you send to 'speak to your team' - the first one is to your pathetic chatbot Tobi and the second doesn't link to anything except your FB page - AAND THERE IS NO WAY TO INITIATE A CHAT ON IT.DO YOU ACTUALLY CHECK THAT LINKS WORK BEFORE YOU WRITE THIS DRIVEL?UPDATE. 21/05/2025. I checked with EE, BT and the openreach engineer who was feeding fiber to my neighbours home, they all confirmed that there was fiber to the road outside my home. HOWEVER - yesterday I had two workmen from Openreach knocked on my door to inform me that they were there to install the pipework for the fiber - when I said I thought it was already in place I was told it stopped about 30 yards before my property, they then dug up  the pavement and installed it.So I owe you and your surveyor an apology.

Review: I went in to see the team in a distraught state having woken up to a dead unresponsive iPhone. I live alone in a rural location and recently had a serious illness diagnosis so to be completely cut off and isolated from my family & friends network and healthcare team is a scary place for me to find myself in.Haz sat me down and said "just breathe, you are in the safest hands", he then proceeded to do all sorts of back room software reboots, transfer all my data, cherished photographs, and my entire life admin to an unused new iPhone I had. It wasn't just the fact he got me back up and running, it was his warmth, caring attitude and his total grasp of the severity of the situation for me that blew me away. Haz treated me with such respect and made me feel valued, his service was way and beyond all my expectations, he really went the extra mile for me. He is a credit to Vodafone and they are very lucky to have him as part of their team. This is a young man who will reach dizzy career heights with the skill set he has. Thank you Haz.

Review: I currently do not have a broadband socket on my wall‚Äîonly a loose, hanging cable. I initially raised the issue with my service provider, Vodafone, and they escalated it through Openreach under ticket number FLT12833411.An Openreach engineer was dispatched, but instead of resolving the issue, he cut the cable and made things worse. He discovered that the cable was faulty and the connection was unstable. He confirmed that the job would require digging and a full cable replacement. As a temporary fix, he created a makeshift connection just so I could have some level of internet, as all my essential home systems (heating, security cameras, lights, etc.) rely on internet connectivity.Unfortunately, around this time, my billing cycle with Vodafone came up. Instead of resolving the issue, Vodafone closed the ticket prematurely, which halted all progress. Since Openreach cannot proceed without an active ticket, I was advised by their engineer to open a new one through Vodafone. After spending more than 4 weeks on first ticket, I did so, and the new ticket number is FLT2893893.It has now been nearly three weeks since the second ticket was raised, and nothing has been done. Vodafone continues to bounce the responsibility around between different teams, while Openreach appears to be unsure of how to proceed.To make matters worse, Vodafone and Openreach have both attempted to shift responsibility to each other, resulting in zero progress and ongoing frustration.In summary, I strongly advise against signing any contract with Vodafone. Their customer service has been disorganized and unprofessional, and their coordination with Openreach has been ineffective and disappointing.
Name: Shahab Aslani

Review: Vodafone uses "Service Level Agreement (SLA)" timelines, rather than responding to urgent need to be in touch with my wife and daughter, and give them access to emergency calls if required.  I have spent over 20 hours now on trying to get them connected, with very little help (or apparently concern) from VodafoneWHERE:  Mexico (off-grid with no connection to telephone service, despite 3-4 bars and recent historical telco access (on previous trips).WHEN: 7 days and countingWHAT:  Immediately upon landing in Mexico, my wife called me on the airport Wifi and let me know that there was no service.VODAFONE's RESPONSE:  IMMEDIATELY, I spent HOURS on the phone trouble-shooting with them (every possible remedy - including trying ESIM, resetting everything, taking off spending cap, setting up data roaming, etc. etc. etc.).  REQUEST TO ESCALATE:  DENIED by Vodafone;  Clearly it was not a fault with my wife or daugher's phone, but Vodafone wouldn't escalte.  I spent Most of Saturday and Sunday speaking with various agents trying to get them connected.QUOTES:  "We have 14 days in which to respond."  I said that it was unconscionable that they would rely on an SLA of 14 days, rather than escalte and try to get my wife and daughter access to being able to call me or local emergency services if they were worried at allCOMPLAINT:   I Logged a COMPLAINT:  Response was the SLA again:  "we have 7 days in which to repond."  You've got to be kidding me!ESCALATION:  FINALLY, on Monday (4 days later), I was told that it was escalated to "engineers," and they wanted "screen shots" of the error messages.  I had them pre-prerared and replied within 2 minutes not only multiple screens, but also with a full list of trouble-shooting steps taken, and texts from Vodafone of instructions, which we/they had followed.  Apparently, this was with "LEVEL 3" tech support (very high - ha!)24 HOURS LATER:  I received a note from the Engineers asking for screenshots of the error messages? ARE YOU KIDDING ME?  I had already sent this, and now sent back at least a dozen.COMPLAINT:  I complained again, and waited on the phone.  In speaking with "Sally" I was told that I was at the highest level of customer service.  I asked for when I would hear back and she said that "there are many other people.... bla bla..." and she "might be in touch within 24 hours."  I couldn't understand how it would take another 24 hours to investigate something which had been ongoing for 5 days and was with top level engineers.  Surely, if ANYONE prioritised it, she could find out immediately.  FINALLY, she PROMISED TO CALL ME BACK IN 1 Hour.- 5 HOURS LATER!  I received a call back from "Josh," who said that he was the highest level of support (wait a minute...?), above Sally.  Ok... When will you promise to call me back (this was around noon).  He wanted to say 24 hours, finally agreed "before he left the office," which would have been the end of the day, and not allow any time for anyone to investigate.  FINALLY, he promised to call me at 4pm, which he did, said that it was being investigated still, but seemed to be moving, but .... "HE WAS TAKING TOMORROW OFF," and would hand over to someone else who would call me.  They didn't, but I did receive an email that said that my wife's phone was connected, but if there were problems to please send MORE SCREENSHOTS.  IT WAS NOT, so I sent even more screenshots.  I had been able to be in touch with my wife and daughter occasionaly, but not while they were home only when they travelled out to a local restaurant and got onto WiFi.I FINALLY received a call when I was in the midst of a meeting, but took it informed them that they were STILL NOT CONNECTED, that I had sent screenshots, and owuld he please email me.1 FULL WEEK LATER:  Still no mobile access.  no Follow up from Josh, who is back at work, and upon calling the "escalation line," spoke with someone who quoted SLA's again and said that they might respond in 24-48 hours.ARE YOU KIDDING ME?This is so shocking that it's beyond comprehension.  If someone were to happen to my wife and daughter, and they could have avoived it by calling for emergency or calling me and having me call others who I know in the area and emergency services, I can just imagine the HEADLINES:  VODAFONE RELIES ON SLAs, rather than tries to do the human and humane thing and try help a young girl and her mother off the grid in MEXICO.UNCONSCIONABLE, CARELESS, and SHOCKING
Name: EAW

Review: I‚Äôm extremely disappointed and frustrated with the experience I‚Äôve had. I originally had broadband with this company, but the service was poor ‚Äî constant buffering and lag made it unusable. When I contacted them about it, I was advised to upgrade, with the promise that it would improve the connection and that I would receive additional equipment to boost the signal in another room.Despite the upgrade, the issues continued. Buffering persisted, and the network performance remained unreliable. After nearly a year of this, I made the decision to disconnect the service and switch to a different provider.What‚Äôs worse, they failed to send me a final bill, yet reported me to credit agencies claiming I owed them money ‚Äî which negatively impacted my credit score. When I called to resolve the matter, I was met with dishonesty and blatant misinformation.Absolutely unacceptable. Disgraceful service ‚Äî avoid at all costs.

Review: Vodafone lost a County Court case on 26/03/2025. The court awarded me ¬£2,115 due to their fraudulent contract and unauthorized charges. Despite multiple emails and a clear legal deadline, they have ignored the court‚Äôs decision and refused to pay. Vodafone also continues to take money from my account. I have full evidence and am taking further legal action. This company has shown no accountability.
Name: Ahmad Jomhor

Review: Took advantage of an upgrade in Vodafone Store 2.4.25 on home phone & Broadband.Deal was to bring my mobile across to Vodafone ¬£5.00 a month which was done in 24 hours. Numerous emails were received regarding the home phone & broadband upgrade. One email stated Vodafone will advise you when upgrade is completed. To complete the upgrade, you need to switch off the router and switch it back on. After the upgrade the cost would be reduced from ¬£28.00 to ¬£26.00 a month for 2-year contract. Visted 3 Vodafone stores as no email were received and each one was helpful. All confirmed that once upgrade was completed my price will be ¬£26.00. Last store confirmed that upgrade was completed on 3.4.2025. Sent Vodafone an email asking them to confirm upgrade completed and home phone & broadband package is now ¬£26.00 a month for 2 years contract that me the customer signed for. Response was sorry you are unhappy with the process. Within their process to notify me of the upgrade completion which they hadn‚Äôt. After 3 emails later 10th April received confirmation upgrade completed. But now my package is a total ¬£34.52 (Mobile ¬£5.00 home phone & broadband ¬£29.52). Three stores confirm this would be ¬£26.00 yet the specialist team state ¬£29.52 same legally binding 2-year contract. Instead of saving money its now costing me more. Vodafone response is I need to call them to get something that I signed a contract for ¬£26.Visited another branch nearly an hour with two staff who found the issue Additional Discount of ¬£2.00 had not been applied thanks to them.  Specialist care team have been advised as well as i have emailed them.Emailed them three times asking for confirmation of the ¬£26 just ignored my emails. Customer has to spend time doing the job of a paid member of staff
Name: james

Review: I had experienced problems in getting my Samsung Gala xy S24 mobile to use mobile data when wifi was not available. Glen the manager at the WGC branch spent considerable time trying to identify the source of the problem. He concluded ghat it was my use of Google Chrome as my internet provider which apparently was not compatible with the use of mobile data. He suggested I use the Samsung Galaxy internet obtainable through Google but not Google Chrome. All is now working well and I am very grateful for all Glen's help.

Review: I signed up with their broadband service just before Christmas last year. When it was time for the wifi to go active, there was no connection. I waited a few days and nothing changed. So I called and they sent out an engineer. After, still nothing. I called up and canceled and was told that they would send me a box to return the hub. They then charged me at the end of the month which I questioned and they said that I would receive the money back once the hub was returned. A month later and they still hadn't sent me the box for the return. Called up again and had to literally drive to the store to return the hub. Another month passes and still no refund, so I called again and then they said I would have to wait another month to receive my money. I waited that time for them to only refund me half of my money. Still haven't been refunded for the rest. Please avoid going with vodafone unless you want to be scammed out of time and money. I would have left a 0 star review if I could.

Review: Just joined about a month ago after 6yrs with Virgin so just like everyone else I needed a first time new fibre cable connected to my property from the telegraph pole in the street. Everything went smoothly enough, except the Openreach installer turning up an hour earlier than the time window I was given (I was in bed) and I never even received an apology although standard of work was very good.The white Power Hub modem (not faulty) is so cheap and nasty and struggles to connect to devices in the next room through a single skin breeze block wall! I‚Äôm not able to get a free Wi-Fi booster from them because I‚Äôm not on an eligible plan so I now have to pay to buy one. The reason I switched, just like others was so it is cheaper. When I factor in the purchase of the booster and the extra electricity this will use, collectively over the course of the contract compared to older provider, I‚Äôm now financially worse off and I can‚Äôt go back for two years! Crazy!!! Another negative - collectively now I will have a third socket permanently taken up in the house compared to just one for my old Virgin modem that worked perfect and had Wi-Fi that reached all over the house! They even have a Wi-Fi full house guarantee and give all customers free boosters if they have a problem.And one more thing - WHY WHY WHY do Vodafone send so much communication?????As I‚Äôd previously said, there has not really been any issues but since signing up, upto now I have received a total of 11 emails and 22 text message!! WHY? I am autistic and am easily overwhelmed so thanks for hitting that tipping point multiple times with unnecessary communications.Oh and them numbers - that does not include communication from Virgin who I left.These companies need to do a lot better!

Review: After telling Vodafone to "Cancel" my order after nothing but lies and stress and total lack of customer service, I was told......I was unable to cancel. I informed Vodafone that I have NO service in my property because Vodafone was "In breach of their contract to me" and therefore I'm in my right to cancel. I asked if I could have a "prepaid" label so that I could return their "Internet Modem" only to be told....."We don't do that"but......"You can return it back to any Vodafone store", Which I did only to receive through the post 2 day's later a pre post label. Vodafone staff don't know what their doing, constant lies!!! *Since my last post, I did receive a response (On here from Vodafone) but, when you ring the number provided.....yet again you are passed from Department to Department and put on hold constantly! So again rubbish customer service and not a clue. Stay away from Vodafone....You have been warned!!!!

Additionally Samsung are currently running a promotion regarding free ear-pods and fit-bit. Uploading receipts, personal details, IMEI numbers to the Samsung site proved too much for me - Sam did it all and I am now awaiting promotional gift. So helpful.

Review: I was topping up by calling 2345, and it didn't work so they passed me through to their customer service. A woman with a foreign accent asked for my card details (including security number at the back) and I foolishly gave her them and told her the amount I wished to top up. It was only after I hung up that I realised what I had done. The top up went through, so it was indeed Vodafone. I then had to go to the trouble of cancelling my card. They should not be asking sensitive information like this! It's ILLEGAL.

Review: As a new resident from Hong Kong, I recently purchased a cellphone from Vodafone and was persuaded to take out their insurance policy, which had a minimum term of three months. Imagine my dismay when I discovered that AppleCare offered the same coverage for just ¬£7 a month on a two-year contract. Unfortunately, due to Vodafone's misleading information, I missed the 60-day window to purchase AppleCare directly from Apple.When I contacted Vodafone to cancel the insurance after the three-month period, I even offered to pay for the entire three months upfront. However, they refused to terminate the policy immediately, citing ridiculous system limitations. This is utterly unacceptable. I should not be forced to pay for a service I no longer want or need.To make matters worse, the staff at Vodafone misled me. As a first-time buyer from a network provider, I was never informed that I could still purchase AppleCare even if the phone was bought elsewhere. This entire experience has been incredibly frustrating and disappointing.Due to this appalling treatment, I will be switching my four phone numbers and broadband service to another provider as soon as my contract ends. I strongly urge others to consider alternatives to Vodafone to avoid similar headaches.

Review: I am writing this reviw to express my frustration regarding an ongoing issue with my account. Despite making my payment, my internet has been restricted because my account did not initially show the payment. I have spent all morning trying to resolve this issue, as I work from home, and my internet is still not functioning.I have spoken to three different agents, each of whom reassured me that the restriction bar had been lifted. However, I find it difficult to understand why this needs to be done by each agent, especially when honesty should be a key part of customer service. If the bar has already been lifted, why does every agent claim to need to do it again?This has led to poor communication and a lack of service, which is disappointing, especially given that I have been a loyal Vodafone customer for years. However, based on this experience, I will not be renewing my contract.I would greatly appreciate it if a manager or team leader could look into this issue and provide a resolution as soon as possible.

They did not seem bothered that my family would be without internet for 2 weeks and that I worked from home. I asked for a manager but was told that he would not be able to help. Review: The worst customer service I have ever experienced. Ordered broadband and a phone sim only to realise the next day they had put down the wrong address. In the end cancelled the entire order and went with BT. Start of the next month I have been charged ¬£10 despite cancelling the order immediately, called to ask for it back they said they would in a month but that I would only get ¬£9.63 back and not ¬£10, yet to receive this still. They have now delivered a WiFi router (to the wrong address) that I had to go pick-up. Called to ask why this was delivered when I‚Äôve cancelled the order and they said ‚Äúit was cancelled on our end but also wasn‚Äôt‚Ä¶‚Äù which makes no sense. Review: ****PLEASE PLEASE AVOID VODAFONE FOR BROADBAND SERVICE****I moved my Home Broadband to Vodafone from SKY, biggest mistake i did.Even 1*  rating is more.I have worst broadband experience in last 12 yearsWe have highest 900 Mbps Vodafone broadband at home.Within 2 nd month of switching Vodafone, Internet outage started, it happend 3 times in 2 conseative weeks (more than 24 hrs).Internet outage so frequent, we did not had any Internet for more than 48 hrs.Even though my repeated request to Vodafone customer care issue was not sorted.Yesterday Internet outage was more than 24 hrs, Vodafone customer care promised that it will get sorted out within 24 hrs and booked Cityfibre Engineer to sort it out.I waited from morning 8-12 PM no show from Vodafone/Cityfibre Engineer, customer care person informed later that Engineer visit is rescheduled between 1PM to 5PM , again no Show.Vodafone customer care person called around 3PM to inform that it again Engineer visit is reschedule to next day.Horrible and Pathetic Customer care.Since I work from home lost 2 days billing.I immediately called other Broadband Services provider to switch.Even though switch new service provider is expensive but I had no choice left.I would recommend everyone who are planning to Switch to Vodafone think twice before switching. Its worst company for Broadband and Customer service, avoid it any cost

Review: I joined Vodafone broadband and there was a promotional offer for ¬£75 bill credit, you would think this would be automatically applied? No.Ive chased this up 3 times, today I used Tobi chat, after i was transferred to an agent, i was getting unrelated messages sent to the point I was confused whether i had actually been transferred to an agent, anyways back to the credit, the 2nd time I called in Feb, I received a text confirming that adter 60 days of activation, i would receive the credit, I didn't, which is why I had to chase again today. 1st agent from billing said she would transfer to home broadband and that i wouldn't have to repeat myself, I did. The 2nd agent was useless and started saying that the text mesnt 60 days after my loss of service was resolved, which I then had to explain again, that it was not due to loss of service but a promotional offer for switching to Vodafone, to which the agent replied that it would be applied in my next bill, but my Vodafone app doesnt show that so I asked for proof, the agent said, ill pass you over to our billing team (AGAIN!!!!), Now the 3rd agent, made me confirm everything again, who now also tried to sell a sim! Not interested. The 3rd agent gave me a link and said I should fill in a form and wait 14 days, are you kidding, I asked for it to be resolved now as i didn't want to wait again, to my surprise NOT, the 3rd agent says, im sorry, i am from the customer care team, i would need to transfer you to the dedicated team, I said I didn't want to be transferred for the 4th time but the agent says that they cant help further, so here I am waiting on the 4th agent, Absolutely ridiculous customer experience Update: still on the chat 2 hrs later, 5th agent said im not eligible, 6th agent was a little more helpful, i noted everything down from my interactions, so i know the date which the agent confirmed on the phone that i was eligible, asked them to listen to the calls, 6th agent has raised a form to another team and said i have to sait 48hrs, so still no proper resolution after 2.5hrs

Review: I have recently had a really poor experience with Vodafone broadband.My contract is Pro Fibre II 910, which sells as up to 910mbps with a guarantee in my contract of at least 455mbps.It's fast but even if I plug directly into my hub, I only get 430mbps at best.  I know this might be picky but I was sold 910 !It worked fairly well until recently but post a recent overnight upgrade it consistently is dropping out. This is what led to me complaining. I can only suggest that as the old cables are becoming defunct that they are pushing more volume through the fibre.Upon discussing with what appears to  be an offshore customer service centre, they quickly shut down my complaint bruskly saying there is no guarantee. (Funny that it states ninimums in my contract.  They can keep to the contract when it comes to annual increases 3.9% above inflation).For a communications company their call centre audio levels are very low and difficult to inderstand.  The call dropped out a few times too.I would not recommend using their broadband and will vote with my feet at renewal

Review: Changing to Vodafone broadband was a big mistake. Their router won't let me split the bands (2.4GHz and 5GHz). So I lost the use of several devices. It was not explained in any way that I would lose functionality of certain devices that have been working just fine for many years and that they've taken away your ability to simply fix it. I've spent four hours this morning in online chat. Finally was able to enable compatibility mode, and have managed to get the printer working that my partner needs for her business. My Sonos system seems to be a lost cause entirely and I'm at the end of my tether. Why they've shut down the facility to split the bands I don't know. And I'm so angry that they made no mention that many devices will not work with their new router during the sign up process. So angry and disappointed.

Review: I have been without broadband for eight months due to Vodafone's negligence. Further, they made commitments to provide me with compensation that they will now not honour, and have made no attempt to compensate me for the loss of my landline in this period.I placed an order for full fibre broadband and a landline on 1st August 2024. I advised Vodafone that dig work was required and Vodafone then guaranteed I would be connected by 27th August.I was finally connected eight months later - and all it took was the right team spending about five hours at my property.I ordered a full broadband service with Vodafone on 01/08/24. They guaranteed to connect me on 27/08/24 (which was the earliest date available). They failed to connect me, and guaranteed by email and text message they would pay me ¬£6.10 compensation for each day until my service is up and running. OpenReach severed my existing copper wire which removed all internet to my property.I called them to discuss this - due to having two young children, and adults working from home I explained it was urgent to connect me. Over the course of the last seven months I also received guarantees that the compensation outlined was the minimum compensation I would receive. Vodafone did offer me compensation for the joining incentives I missed out on, although they are refusing to pay these to my bank account.During the seven months my repeated attempts to get Vodafone to connect me has been unsuccessful. OpenReach will not accept any direct contact from me, and will only work with suppliers. The sheer scale of incompetence on display has been staggering including:OpenReach severing my broadband and phone line connectionI had phoned Vodafone prior to 27/08/24 and advised that digging was needed to connect, and Vodafone assured me that OpenReach were fully aware and prepared to connect me on that day - the team then turned up with no prior briefingOpenReach seeking permission from my neighbours to dig on a shared drive located in a different town to fix the problemOpenReach wrongly assuming my repair needed a dig on a shared driveway - which was not neededVodafone repeatedly taking money from my bank account during this periodVodafone has sent numerous engineers who have turned up with no briefing that there is an issue at the property, and each time believed they only had to replace a connected copper wire with a full fibre wireVodafone unilaterally cancelling my order, forcing me to place another orderVodafone sending conflicting contradictory messages on compensation to meVodafone has been entirely reactive and passive in their approach to remedying this issue, failing to in any way manage their suppliersAfter Vodafone waiting for over six months for OpenReach to connect my property to the network, which they completed on 06/03/25, Vodafone were not ready to connect me due to an issue with Vodafone's back office. That is correct, six months was not enough time for Vodafone to ensure their internal systems could provide the service, and they believe they will connect me on 02/04/25.When the correct team arrived at my property, they were able to connect the full fibre cable from my property to the network in less than seven hours. The only digging they did was on a public pavement where no permissions from residents were required.To add insult to injury, Vodafone have repeatedly used the agreement (or code of conduct they signed up to) with the regulator as a limitation on their ability to pay out compensation, and have stated to me on numerous occasions that this agreement prevents them compensation me in line with the commitments they made to me verbally, by email, and by text message. They are seeking to limit their compensation to a maximum of sixty days. This code automatically provides minimum compensation, and assumes proper conduct by suppliers.I have pointed out to Vodafone on many occasions that their legal team have approved the commitments which they make by email and text messages to customers they let down in this way.
Name: Declan Meenan

Review: Vodafone UK in Ely offers great customer service. Ana and Thea were professional and friendly, while Oliver helped save ¬£50 on monthly contracts. It's clear the staff genuinely care about meeting customer needs and finding the best plans available. Overall, a reliable and helpful local store making upgrades and queries hassle-free. 4/5 stars!

Review: We set up broadband for our new house a few weeks ago which all seemed fine, but the day after we got an email saying the order had been cancelled with no explanation. After being unsuccessful in getting an explanation over the phone, we had to go into a Vodafone store (The Trafford Centre, Manchester) and were told that it was a glitch and that the order was fine and still scheduled for the 3rd and openreach would be in touch sometime before the install date. Well it‚Äôs the 3rd today and we hadn‚Äôt been contacted by them and had no router. Called up customer service and they said the order had in fact been cancelled and then offered to set up a new order with no discount and it would take the same 10-14 days as originally. So now we‚Äôve had 2 weeks wasted and still no WiFi. I‚Äôve previously had issues with transferring phone contracts as well so will be avoiding this company at all costs from now on. Don‚Äôt bother!
Name: Emily

Review: If you want to swap your WiFi to Vodafone at the end of your WiFi contract, do it a month or two in advanced!I have been without WiFi since the 14th of march 2025 now and I am still no where near having my new vodafone full fibre installed. My original install date with Vodafone (city fibre) was the 17th of march 2025 and as of today I am still without WiFi. City fibre are coming by to do an asbestos check today but then I have to wait for the results, have another visit for wire planning and then finally the install and activation. They have no regard or care for their customers at all which is very clear when on the phone to them and I haven't even started my WiFi contract with Vodafone yet. I cannot stress enough how much it is probably worth paying more for sky or virgin full fibre instead as this whole process has been horrific and shameful. If I'm lucky I'll have my WiFi installed and activated by the 17th of April 2025, a whole month late.They also do NOT tell you this information in advanced, you get a text message the day before your install date saying it has been "delayed"!!DO NOT GO WITH CITY FIBRE AND VODAFONE FOR INTERNET!!!
Name: Ethan Starbuck

Review: Worst mobile network I‚Äôve ever had the misfortune of signing up to. I left them a year ago but they can‚Äôt or won‚Äôt erase my account and refund me the credit. Hopeless customer service, do yourself a favour and avoid them.

Review: Subject: Formal Complaint Regarding Broadband Service and Customer SupportDear Vodafone Customer Service Team,I am writing to formally express my dissatisfaction with the service I have received since signing up for a new broadband deal with Vodafone. While I have been a loyal fan of Vodafone, my recent experience has left me extremely disappointed.One of the key benefits of the broadband package I signed up for included a one-year free subscription to McAfee antivirus. However, I only received six months instead of the full year. When I raised this issue, I was provided with a mere ¬£20 compensation, my daughter received 1gb, which does not adequately address the shortfall in service.Furthermore, throughout my time using Vodafone broadband, I have encountered numerous issues, including inconsistent service quality and poor customer support. Each time I have reached out to resolve my concerns, I have had to deal with unhelpful and argumentative staff. Despite contacting customer service five or six times, I have never received a text message inviting me to provide feedback on my experience. This raises concerns about Vodafone‚Äôs commitment to customer satisfaction and continuous improvement.I expect Vodafone to rectify this situation by:1. Providing me with the remaining six months of McAfee antivirus as originally promised.2. Addressing the poor customer service experience I have endured.3. Ensuring that your feedback system is operational and includes all customers, so experiences like mine can be reported and addressed.I look forward to your prompt response and a satisfactory resolution to my concerns. Should I not receive a satisfactory reply within 14 days, I will be left with no choice but to escalate my complaint to the appropriate regulatory bodies.Please acknowledge receipt of this complaint and provide a clear timeline for resolution.Yours sincerely,Steven Johnson

Review: After speaking with an agent on Friday, it was advised it would be in my best interest to cancel the upgrade, I had JUST placed and reraise once cancelled. I was advised it would take 1-2 days for this to be processed. On Sunday I followed this up, to be told yes the cancellation had indeed been placed and to wait a further day for it to proces, following procedure. Monday I contacted again, as I had not received a text confirming cancellation, this agent told me again it had been placed but could take a little bit longer to receive confirmation, again I was fine with this. Tuesday came along, still no text. I contact the webchat team AGAIN, to be told by the agent that the upgrade was still showing as active and that they would transfer me to the correct team. The agent on the returns team told me as per the text, I did NOT receive, it would be 2/4 that cancellation would be placed and that I would receive the text confirming. Surprise surprise, that day came and nothing. I contact the team again to be told the cancellation was not placed and that it's fine because it will automatically be cancelled in 3 days. The amount of time I have wasted on my dinner break is disgusting, and no accountability has been taken for the gross miscommunication I have received over the last few days. I will be passing this onto family and friends, and anyone who will listen

Review: Ridiculous proforma response, that does not begin to address my problem:Firstly, "Should the problem persist, we encourage you to reach out to our Broadband teams by calling 0333 304 0191 or by using our Live Chat feature available here: (link given but not permitted in reviews). Our team is ready to assist you and ensure that your concerns are addressed promptly". I am way past this stage in resolving my problem, which was not addressed, let alone promptly!Secondly, "please feel free to connect with my team on Facebook at (link given but not permitted in reviews)." I do not use (anti) social media, so cannot contact in this manner.Thirdly, if you had even started to read my problem, you would have understood (I hope) that the problem has nothing to do with social media, so I have no idea why anyone in Vodafone thought it appropriate that the Social Media Team could even begin to understand the problem, let alone resolve it. It is an IT technical problem, which is why I was communicating with your IT Support team. If you in the Social Media Team are going to take it upon yourselves to resolve IT technical problems, at least read and understand the problem!You are an an extraordinarily inept and inefficient organisation and you must please accept this review as FORMAL NOTICE that I am CANCELLING both my mobile phone and my broadband contracts WITH IMMEDIATE EFFECT. I cannot do this via my accounts because, as will know, if you had read all this communication, I cannot access my accounts.If you wish to escalate this matter as an official complaint and have already contacted the Broadband Teams without receiving a satisfactory resolution, please feel free to connect with my team on Facebook at (link given but not permitted in reviews). We are here to help you.Thank you,Vodafone Social Media TeamProblem No.1: I have had a Vodafone mobile contract for some time and, when my broadband contract (with another company) came towards its termination date, I thought it would be sensible to use Vodafone for broadband also. I went through all the necessary and the kit arrived and was installed (although I had to pay a local IT support company to do this. I challenge any IT layman to be able to do this without assistance). This cost alone exceeded the saving I was making by moving broadband supplier to Vodafone. I had to set up a second Vodafone account for the broadband supply.However, I was then unable to access either of the accounts I had/have with Vodafone.Then started the second pain experience ‚Äì being transferred eventually to Vodafone IT Support. I have rarely, if ever, encountered such inept and unhelpful service. This terminated(?) in my being told to try yet another ‚Äòsolution‚Äô, immediately followed by an email stating ‚ÄúHello,Your ticket has been set to Resolved status. Review: I recently had an issue with my SIM port and visited the Vodafone store in Brent Cross for assistance. Three sales advisors‚Äîtwo males and one female‚Äîattempted to help me, but none could figure out the problem. One of them didn‚Äôt even bother to ask about the issue or try to help. The other two, unable to resolve it, kept telling me to ‚Äúwait 24 hours and come back,‚Äù as if that were a real solution.I don‚Äôt even live near Brent Cross, yet I made the trip twice, hoping for a resolution. On my last visit, I was given an advisor‚Äôs email‚ÄîSabi‚Äîto contact if my SIM still didn‚Äôt work. Unsurprisingly, when I reached out the next day, he completely ghosted me and never responded.When I contacted Vodafone‚Äôs online customer service, they told me to visit a store for help. But if this is the kind of treatment customers receive, what‚Äôs the point? These employees seem more interested in avoiding responsibility than actually helping customers. When I requested to speak to a manager or someone more experienced, I was conveniently told that the assistant manager was the highest authority available‚Äîessentially shutting down any possibility of escalation.It‚Äôs clear that this store prioritizes sales over customer service. If your employees have no interest in solving issues, they shouldn‚Äôt offer false assurances, making customers waste their time and money traveling to the store for nothing. It has now been seven days without a working network, and Vodafone has shown zero accountability.This whole experience has negatively impacted my mental health and disrupted my work, as I have been left without a phone network for a full week. Instead of helping, the staff at this store have only added to my frustration with their pretentious and unprofessional attitude.I strongly recommend avoiding Vodafone, especially this branch. If you value real customer service and reliability, go with any other network‚Äîthis one is a complete disgrace.

Review: I have no idea where all these excellent reviews have come from. I came back to Vodafone after a break because of poor customer service, I don't know why as since then I have had a catalogue of mistakes. Most recently I have been unable to access mobile data on one of my mobile phones, there is a data bar on the phone which I cannot remove online it says it is removed then toggles back on. This happened back last year and I contacted Vodafone who turned it back on. This is now no longer the case and Vodafone are unable to offer this anymore. Instead they now how to fill out forms to request it is switched back on. These forms take 24 hours maximum, something they confirmed to me by text. 24 hours passed and I still had no data, I used the chat again which is frustrating and awful long you are left with long silences and no reply to be met with an automated message telling you they'll disconnect the chat shortly. I have now spent hours on webchat and also on the phone where I have been told I need to wait a further 48 hours for someone to look at why I have no data. In the meantime I have had to buy a sim from Tesco mobile so I can use my phone for work. Also when I was complaining to Vodafone they tried to upsell me a sim only plan and tried to get me to upgrade my broadband. Neither of which appeals when I have a phone that isn't fit for purpose. I wouldn't recommend Vodafone to anyone, I have broadband, 2 phones, 2 wearables and a tablet and this is the treatment I receieve they literally don't care. I have no resolution to my issue, no-one can tell me what to do apart from 'wait'. I will not be renewing anything with vodafone as they're appalling.

Review: If I could zero stars I would. This company have been nothing but incompetent. My uncle has had no end of issues with the wifi connection in his home recently, and it  appears that his router is failing. It turns itself off frequently and we are forever having to unplug it and plug it back in to reboot it. We have been on the phone to them today only to discover their whole customer support workforce is completely incompetent. Absolutely no offer of sending a technician out to look at the rooter to diagnose the issue, and refusing to send out a replacement router. Just keep going round and round in circles telling us everything is fine. My uncle is a vulnerable, disabled pensioner and lives in a very isolated area with no mobile signal‚Ä¶.so he relies on a working internet connection to be able to contact his support network. If something was to happen to him, and the wifi was not working it could quite literally be a life or death situation. Vodafone do not appear to be taking this seriously, and we are now looking to cancel our contract and move over to a company that is focused on providing a quality service. Don‚Äôt waste your money on this circus.

Review: This is honestly the worst provider I have ever been with.  I initially enquired about the broadband and was persuaded to add my 2 mobile phones to the account to receive a Vodafone together discount and save some money.  It has taken 6 months to get the discount applied, having to call their customer services on a monthly basis.  The calls usually take at least one hour as they always have to go and check something with another department. Now I‚Äôve been hit with a 15% increase on the overall plan, which I was lead to believe was about 3% per year on the 1st of April each year.  I‚Äôve only been with them 6 months.  The broadband work was carried out poorly, my brickwork was damaged and the old cables were left hanging from the wall.  Vodafone said this was not there responsibly and I‚Äôd have to take this up with Open Reach.  To date no repairs have been undertaken.  I am overall in a worse position than I was paying for my mobiles and broadband separately and the customer service is terrible, it takes months to get anything sorted.  Don‚Äôt be drawn in by the together discount, it will cost you long term.  I have today been quoted an exit fee of ¬£183.00, so it looks like I‚Äôm stuck with them for another 18 months.  Worst mistake I‚Äôve made‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. UPDATE:  Vodafone asking me to reach out to them, the worst customer service team I‚Äôve ever had the misfortune to contact.  They are totally incompetent!  I would at the very least expect them to call me.  They switched both my mobiles to their Network stating I would be saving money, only now I am paying more.  They don‚Äôt tell you that!  They are a disgrace‚Ä¶.

Review: Vodafone were fined ¬£4.6 million pounds in 2016 for serious breaches of the Consumer protection Rules. From my experience they have learnt very little.My Experience!I ordered Vodafone broadband in December 2024 for activation on 14th January 2025. My router was sent but never arrived around the 17th December 2024 and for some reason was returned to Vodafone. I heard nothing from Vodafone, so a week before the date for the line activation, I contacted Vodafone and asked them when my router will arrive as no router, no broadband. They confirmed they had received the original router but did nothing! I reminded them my activation date was on the 14th January 2025 and they said they would expedite delivery on another router. In short the router did not arrive in time and activation was a day late with me without broadband for the 14th January 2025.I complained to them, not easy, and told them I expected some compensation.My bill arrived on the 15th March 2025 and he bill stated that Vodafone were charging me from the 14th January 2025 even though they were aware of their incompetence in ensuring they delivered the service on the agreed date of the 14th January 2025. Unfortunately I was flying to Asia on the 17th February and had no time to contact them thinking that they would act correctly as they were aware of the incorrect bill. I then received an email chasing me for payment on the 3rd March 2025 and 3 days later they disconnected my broadband. Phoning them from Asia was ¬£2 per minute so that was not an option. However on the 8th I contacted them on the chat facility but they were unhelpful and seemed to have difficulty in understanding the situation. On my return I phoned them from the uk and asked them to reconnect the service. They said I would need to pay them first including the time the line had been cut off and they probably would have added a reconnection charge. I decided they were jot a company to give my money too so I ordered a new line with Virginia media. Router and line activated in 4 days. I await contact from Vodafone to return their router and pay them for the time I had their service, from the 15th January to the 3rd March 2025 plus the confirmation.My advice..Do not put up with bad service and do not use Vodafone for any of your communications.Vodafone replied as you can see. Said to DM them with no contact details. They send text and emails to you which you cannot reply to. Pathetic!

Review: ***edit*** Vodafone left the below comment on my review asking me to please get in touch with their complaints team via X or Facebook (does anybody under the age of 35 have an account on either of these platforms?) or call their complaints line. I did the latter, and was assured blindly that I would be connected the following day as initially advertised. I asked how I would be connected without having had a router sent out to me. The woman said I'd also receive the router the following day. I asked why this was suddenly a possibility when my previous requests had provided me no useful information - she said she didn't know but insisted I would be up and running the following day, and even said I would be entitled to compensation (?!) which we could speak about once the service had been established. It is now 7 days later and I have had no communication whatsoever and no modem or router. As a result, Vodafone has now truly earned the coveted 1 star review from me and I am cancelling my order.***Hours spent chasing connection date. The agents are individually polite, but you have to speak to a useless AI bot and beg to be connected to one, and are then passed between 4 or 5 people to try to find an answer. The chat continuously warns you that you haven't replied and that it will shortly terminate, even if you are staring at the screen watching an agent type. When I mentioned this, they asked me to kindly reply once per minute to say 'ok' just so the chat window wouldn't close. What kind of user testing was done on this system? I have been talking for literally hours on 3 occasions at this stage to find out what is going on with my broadband provision. It was supposed to be happening 37 days after I set up my order. I get periodic texts which vaguely imply that my order is being held up, but nothing further.  Vodafone never reach out, so I am forced to contact them every time for an update. Most of the time the agent pastes an update that tends to involve technical terminology and acronyms. I work in tech, so they often have some kind of meaning to me but is this how they speak to non-technical people? It must be quite confusing for normal people to be updated with information like this.The status seems to be that Openreach haven't yet fully provisioned the termination at my address, despite the fact that I placed this order specifically because Openreach emailed me to say that FTTP was available at my address and there are OFS fibre-optic boxes above every flat door in my building. This implies that somewhere, the data is wrong or something is being failed to be communicated properly. Vodafone's solution is to ask me to contact them again in 11 days for an update. I asked if they would contact me instead, since I am a new customer and don't appreciate being asked to continuously chase updates on what should be a simple joining process. They declined. I asked if they are able to notify my current provider not to terminate my service on Monday leaving me without any internet access, they said I would have to do it. In conclusion, I will have been waiting close to 2 months for service to be provisioned by the time I have to next reach out to Vodafone, for an update that to be honest I have very little faith will be any sort of resolution for my problem. I understand that Vodafone's partners appear to be holding up the provision, but to be left in the dark continuously and told to chase information myself is lousy and lazy customer service from the business. It would be totally unacceptable for someone in my line of work to do this to a client, so it's pretty disappointing to experience this as someone who just wants to be able to stream Netflix in HD.
