Review: I recently had a very poor experience with Vodafone's customer service. Three months ago, I signed up for broadband, but the third-party installer placed the cable in a very prominent spot on the front of my house without properly explaining how it would look.I contacted Vodafone to request that the third-party provider reposition the router and connection box to improve the cable's appearance. Both Vodafone and the third party were uncooperative, and I had to insist on management intervention, I was told I‚Äôd receive a call within 72 hours from the third party‚Äî which never happened.  After several follow-ups (initiated by me) I was informed it would take up to 10 days, beyond the cooling-off period, so I ultimately cancelled the contract after waiting as long as possible for some communication from the third party. I contacted Vodafone to have the third party remove their tools and cable, as it was no longer needed since I had cancelled the contract (due to the poor service I had received). I was told that returning the router would prompt them to do so. After a week with no response, I called again and was told I‚Äôd have to pay for the removal. I had to insist on the issue being escalated.After multiple calls, emails, and being misinformed, the third party finally removed the cable and tools, five weeks after my initial complaint. Vodafone wanted to close the case, despite not  having refunded my pre-paid bill. I was told I‚Äôd receive a full refund, but only got 52%. When I contacted my customer care rep, I received no response and had to reach out to Vodafone via a different avenue, to understand why. I was told I was charged for the days the service worked. Although I found a clause about non-refundable installation charges, there was nothing indicating I‚Äôd be charged for service within the cooling period. Throughout the process, I made numerous calls and had to repeatedly explain my issue. I was misinformed about how my complaint would be resolved and what refund I‚Äôd receive. I was also told multiple times that the third party would contact me within a certain period, but this never happened. Even using Vodafone‚Äôs online chat, I was passed from pillar to post and had to repeat myself. The process was arduous and unnecessarily complicated with great disconnect and lack of communication between departments. I found Vodafone to be very resistant to taking responsibility for the negligence of their third party and they would have been happy to let the consumer take the hit if I had not insisted. As a result, I will be avoiding Vodafone as a supplier for any of my products in the future. Review update on 13th April: On the 1st of April I received a call from my customer service rep, in response to the email I had sent  week previously, querying why I had not received a full refund. I was advised that I had received 'pro-rata credit' but had been charged for the days the service had been active. I expressed dissatisfaction at this and suggested that a complete refund as I had originally been led to believe, would be a gesture of good will from Vodafone. This has taken a couple of weeks to resolve but in the end I have received receive the full refund. For this reason I have added a star to the review (originally one star) but would not add more as overall the process was lengthy and required the customer to put in a lot of time and effort to achieve a satisfactory solution.

Review: Well now, gather round, young‚Äôuns, and lend an ear to an old codger who‚Äôs seen the rise and fall of dial-up, the golden age of Nokias, and the WiFi wars of 2007. But let me tell you, in all my years battling signal bars and baffling billing statements, never‚Äînever!‚Äîhave I come across a pair like Hayley and Josh.These two whippersnappers at Vodafone are the Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers of customer service‚Äîgraceful, in sync, and boy, do they make solving problems look like a dance!Hayley, with the voice smoother than a jazz sax at midnight, guided me through my tangled contract woes like a lighthouse in a digital storm. And Josh? That lad‚Äôs got more charm than a vintage jukebox. Quick-witted, razor-sharp, and kind enough to explain tech lingo in a way even my old brain could understand.They didn‚Äôt just sort me out‚Äîthey made me feel seen. Like an actual person, not just an account number floating in the cloud. A rare thing these days.So hats off, canes raised, and a heartfelt thank you to Hayley and Josh. Vodafone‚Äîgive these two a raise, or at least a throne of recycled SIM cards and eternal glory.Yours in dependable signal and newfound faith in customer care,‚ÄîOld Man G (still kickin‚Äô, still connected)

Have complained to Vodafone who now say it will take 6weeks. Obviously Vodafone don‚Äôt understand Ofcoms rules.BT paid my neighbour his compensation within 1 week.The reply from Vodafone to my comments is no different from other replies they have made to adverse comments. No doubt their response was AI generated without any human review.I don‚Äôt use either Facebook or X so their response is meaningless and insincere

First, you screwed up. I had to chase you. Your mistake costed me 30¬£ and half a day to figure out who screwed it up. You offer me 10¬£ to a Morrisons that does not exist in central London? Review: While I had a business broadband contract with Vodafone, I was treated more like a captive consumer than a valued business customer.Closing the account was deliberately obstructive. There was no straightforward "non-renewal" option‚Äîinstead, I was told I had to contact Vodafone exactly 30 days before the end of my contract to avoid renewal. Not before, not after. This is a ridiculous and impractical requirement for any customer, let alone a business one.Over the course of three separate interactions‚Äîvia calls and chat, totalling over 1.5 hours, I was repeatedly subjected to intrusive marketing questions (e.g. who I was switching to, how much I would pay), despite making it crystal clear I only wanted to cancel. Even after I stated clearly and repeatedly that I didn‚Äôt want to discuss alternatives or promotions, Vodafone representatives persisted in trying to upsell me other products (like mobile contracts). It felt deliberately designed to wear me down.In the first two interactions, lasting around 30 minutes each, I was not allowed to cancel, but that didn‚Äôt stop the agents from trying to sell me upgrades. Only on the third attempt was I finally able to terminate the contract.This is not how business customers should be treated. The offboarding experience was obstructive, time-consuming, and frankly, borderline abusive. I don‚Äôt know whether this practice is legal, but it is certainly unethical.I would strongly advise any business considering Vodafone to think twice. You are not treated with professionalism or respect.I will be raising a formal complaint and follow up as needed with the ombudsman.
Name: Andres

Review: Dear Vodafone Headquarters,Rating: 0/5I am writing to express my deep frustration and disappointment with the service provided by your German branch. My recent experiences have been extremely negative, and I believe they warrant immediate attention and intervention from HQ. Here is a detailed account of the issues I have faced:Silent Charges and SEPA-Lastschrift: Vodafone Germany silently charged me ‚Ç¨87.37 through SEPA-Lastschrift without any prior notification or explanation. Additionally, despite my switch to Telekom on the 14th of March, they charged me the full price of ‚Ç¨39.99 for the entire month. This is unacceptable as I used their services for only half a month.Incompetent Customer Support: When I contacted Vodafone Germany's customer support, the representatives were completely unresponsive and incompetent. Their behavior led me to believe that they were not even affiliated with Vodafone. They wasted my time for hours without providing any real support or solutions.False Promises: During one of my numerous attempts to resolve the issue, I was told to wait for a fake conversation with their supervisor. Eventually, they promised a refund that they claimed was already processed to my Vodafone account and would be transferred to my bank account soon. However, there is no balance in my Vodafone account at all. When I asked for confirmation, they provided none and failed to prove or even acknowledge the payment.Lack of Transparency and Speculative Communication: There was no information available in the customer portal about the mysterious charges. Every time I contacted Vodafone via email, they responded with an SMS asking me to call for explanations. This is clearly a speculative tactic to avoid written documentation that could be used in court. Calls cannot be easily proven, making this strategy a clear sign of cheating and lack of transparency.Inadequate Communication: Vodafone Germany's communication strategy seemed to be designed to deter customers from pursuing their issues. Their SMS and phone call explanations were vague and unhelpful.SEPA-Lastschrift Feature: I recently discovered that I can cancel SEPA-Lastschrift transactions within 8 weeks to get my money back. Now, Vodafone Germany has the audacity to ask me to pay for half of March again! Absolutely infuriating!Poor Technical Competence: The technical competence of Vodafone Germany‚Äôs support is also at the lowest level. Their main solution to any issue is simply to restart the device. There is no stable connection, regardless of the speed offered. It doesn‚Äôt matter at which speed I experience breakdowns of internet connection; what matters is having a reliable service, which Vodafone Germany fails to provide.Unprofessional Conduct: To top it all, a drunk Vodafone Germany employee visited my home, trying to convince me to sign up for double contracts with nonsensical arguments. This kind of behavior is completely unprofessional and unacceptable.Important Advice: Never, never, never trust what they say. Do not waste time on phone calls. Never allow them SEPA-Lastschrift; pay by yourself with transfer. Always ask for confirmations otherwise never confirm anything. Never open the door to Vodafone employees who come without an appointment.Overall, my experience with Vodafone Germany has been extremely negative, and I would advise anyone considering their services to steer clear. They have shown a blatant disregard for customer satisfaction and transparency, and their support is laughably incompetent.Request for HQ Action: I urgently request that Vodafone Headquarters take immediate action to address these severe issues within your German branch. Adequate training, better communication protocols, and transparency are essential to regaining customer trust. Alternatively, I would suggest Vodafone withdrawing from the German market if these issues continue to persist, as they are damaging the brand‚Äôs reputation. Perhaps these issues are deliberate, targeting the German market differently from the UK market. But comparing the ratings (Germany 1.4 vs UK 4.5), it leaves me questioning whether it's paid negligence or a lack of care about the German market.Vodafone needs to seriously address these issues and improve its services if it wants to retain customers. My life would indeed be easier if Vodafone Germany could simply explain their charges and provide genuine support.Feel free to contact me for a more detailed opinion and experience.Sincerely yourth, unsatisfied customer.

Review: I used this provider for many years, and they were once reliable. However, Vodafone has become increasingly greedy as a commercial service and no longer prioritises its customers. Customer service is equally frustrating‚Äîthey employ manipulative tactics, shifting the blame onto the customer or insisting that your handset is the issue.Vodafone‚Äôs EU roaming coverage is also declining. Many of the so-called ‚Äúpositive‚Äù reviews seem questionable, suggesting the company may be encouraging favourable feedback to mask its unethical practices.Thankfully, my contract has now ended, and I‚Äôll be looking for a more affordable and reliable provider. Avoid this manipulative company at all costs.

Review: PLEASE READ THIS WHEN THINKING OF SIGNING UP.Ignore how much the monthly payments are, as this is neglibable compared to the amount you will pay overall. Your phone will go out of contract. You will suddenly start getting charged huge amounts over the odds for the same service. You will go to a comparison site, get a new deal. Then try to contact Vodafone to get a PAC code to move your number. They will purposely make this impossible for you to get. I had to answer 5 security questions, like which month and year did my contract start, and how manyt connections do i have (my kids have them on my account but i have no idea). You then cancel direct debit as they are taking out more money each month. You cant cancel it the vodafone account though without answering the security questions. So next thing you get a letter saying you owe ¬£100's and it affects your credit rating. You end up paying more than the years contract just to get rid of them. Horrific.

Review: Outright lied. Asked to cancel, was told it would be free. A full month later with no warning, no bill, no contact at all, I am charged over ¬£150 for terminating the contract. When I call them, again - it's well even though we told you twice it was free, you should have known that it wasn't. Complete scam. Horrible attitude. No empathy a single time I called. Review: Got full fibre broadband installed from them. I was told it was the fastest speed I would be able to get. Turned out to be slower than what I was currently getting from BT. Cancelled less than 24 hours into contract. Vodafone still took off the full amount and then had the cheek to tell me I wouldn't get a full refund as it was active for 7 days. The router was in transit back to them for 5 days so charged for sending their router back to them. Best thing is they kept telling me to give it 14 days to "settle" but big difference between 910Mbs and 430Mbs. If I had done that I would have either been tired into the contract for 24 months or had to pay the full month. Nice scam to get free money from people. Last time I go anywhere near this absolute rip off disgusting dishonest company.Live chat states that I will get a partial refund when next bill is produced. Checked my account and it specifically states that no future bills will be produced. What this means is that I will not get ANY refund as they have considered it closed. Told BT about this and they upgraded my speed (now twice what Vodafone claimed was the fastest I could get) and reduced my bill. At least decent companies still exist.***UPDATE***Vodafone replied to this to contact them to sort it. This basically involves contacting them to be told I am correct. I have to pay for the days that the router is in transit despite having no way of accessing the internet and if it takes 3 day or 10 days then that's tough and you have to pay until they receive the router as they don't disconnect until they do. Please be aware anyone that if you are not satisfied then I would not listen to their customer service and wait the 14 days for it to "settle" as there is a good chance you will end up tied into a 2 year contract if there is a delay in the router getting back to them.

Review: Vodaphone managed to cancel my direct debit in December 2024, 2 emails sent notifying me of subsequent payments due went into junk and I didn't see them. Only discovered as went online to cancel the account, saw monies owed and tried to call to get to bottom of what went wrong. After over an hour having been put on hold, cut off twice, had to call back, I decided that life was too short and just paid the late payment fee & monies owed. Then got a call back from vodaphone, I explained that contract is up in 2 months ( for sim in electric gates ¬£5.37/month) and just wanted to pay to end and not renew the contract. Told that I could only cancel by phone, another wait to be put through to relevant department.Then told cancellation only possible if they send a code to sim number in the gates which doesn't receive texts!! I have another number logged with vodaphone for security which I use for online log in but apparently they couldn't send code to this. She suggested I take the sim out of gates, put it in another phone, I explained that I don't have any old phones lying around, she was adamant that was the only way it could be done. Refused to put me through to anyone else.

Review: This is an update 30 March 25,I was left holding for 40minutes.Interestingly, as I am writing this review a team attempted to call me x2 whilst holding on for a technician!!!Avoid Vodafone. This is probably the worst network provider in Bedford. The team members in Bedford store are very good. ‚≠ê ‚≠ê ‚≠ê ‚≠ê Sadly the network in the area appears to be extremely poor.  Initially a report stated they had good net work coverage. Sadly this is not true. (My broadband service box arrived on the day of the 2 week  cooling of period). And have been locked into their contract.  Frequently I'm unable to make calls indoors/home.The customer service unnecessarily protracted and even more so when you request for a Puk number to leave the network. Their policy appears to lock their unhappy  customer into bondage.  The technical team try to prevent customers leaving insisting on carrying troubshooting tests. Reinforcing  the difficulties of leaving the networkIf a customer decides to leave a termination fee 135 pounds is then required this then as more frustration to the customer.On 25 March I terminated the call after waiting for a technician  to sort out my issue..the matter still remains outstanding.The saga continues!!The network service is poor..error message "unregistered calls" or not connected to Internet/wifi and unable to have a conversation without the line dropping several times. üò§ Ironically when I requested to make a direct complaint my network remained quite strong ü§∑üèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Review: I have been with Vodafone for a few years with both my broadband and sim. They offered for me to upgrade to fibre broadband which they told me alike be faster than my broadband at the time. It wasn‚Äôt. In fact when I changed providers because it was so slow I was told that Vodafone don‚Äôt even yet have the rights to full fibre in my area yet. I tried to complain but the technical support team practically laughed at me and denied that I had ever been sold fibre (I have an email which confirms this). I cancelled my contract as soon as I could get out of it and gave 30 days notice. I received emails from Vodafone to confirm that they were sorry to see me leave. Two months later I was shocked to see that Vodafone had taken ¬£26 out of my account. When I called to complain, they firstly tried to tell me that I hadn‚Äôt given notice and when I told them I had emails to confirm this they backtracked and told me it was a valid payment. Review: I was using Vodafone Broadband in my previous house. I have now moved into a new house. Before I move into a new house, I have called up the customer service and requested to move the broadband connection to my new house.1st Call: I have been transferred to 3 different agents. 1st agent told me that they don't provide service in the new address(even though I have moved to a different address in the same town). 2nd agent told me that they do provide the service in the new address, but told me they can't continue the existing contract and I have to go for a new 24months contract(even though I have been told I can move my connection to new address with the existing contract when I took the contract). 3rd agent again said that they don't provide service in that area. This whole conversation took about 1hr 50min. I had to end the call due to some personal reasons.2nd Call: This time only one agent(Dexter) - But, he told me they don't do the premise move and offered me a new contract for 24Months with higher prices. I was shocked to know that they don't do premise move and trying to upsell.Since I needed internet, I agreed to go for a new contract and requested for the same price. Dexter said he will check with his manager about the price and get back to me later that day or by next day.I have waited for 3days and no one called me.3rd Call: I have called them to check the status. I have been told that the previous agent(Dexter) had run the credit check(without my consent) and it has been rejected and now they will not provide me with a new contract either. The agent asked me to cancel the contract. I have requested for call transfer to their supervisor. But I have been told that they can't do that, but they will raise a request for a call back from supervisor in less than 48 hours.I have waited for 6days and nothing happened(I have already moved to a new house by this time without internet)4th Call: Different agent(Jam) - I got fed up and requested to cancel the contract. But, the agent said she can't do that as there is an action pending on my account(supervisor call). She has told me that she will speak to the previous agent and arrange a call back in one hour(at this point I have lost the trust on Vodafone and their customer service). This never happened. 5th Call: Different Agent - I have explained the situation. He asked me the details of new house trying to run the credit check again without knowing it has already been done. I have then asked him, not to run the credit check and just cancel the contract. HE HAS DONE IT without any cancellation fee.DON'T go for VODAFONE unless you want a stressful house move and rude customer service.Customer Service agents will say "We understand your situation", when they actually don't.

Review: Oh how ironic. Having experienced weeks of really poor quality Wi-Fi and regular broadband drop-outs (I'm supposed to be on Full Fibre 150), I tried the 'Vodafone Broadband Service test' on their website yesterday. Twice during the test the broadband signal dropped out and eventually the test 'froze' on the final part - presumably telling me I'm not getting what I'm paying for. Does anyone at Vodafone want to speak to me regarding this matter? That's a firm 'no' as they claim everything is running as it should - well not from where I'm sitting it isn't. Promises, promises and then failed delivery. One day I'll learn not to believe what they tell me. Renew my contract? Not a chance after this.Update following Vodafone's reply. I called the number as requested (25/4/25). They ran all of their tests. Solution? I need to upgrade to a higher package with a new 24 month contract. Essentially they are telling me (without actually telling me) my 6 month old router probably isn't up to the job and if I pay a bit more, get better equipment and start again - it'll all be fine. Great news. Also - they tell me I can't plug someone else's Wi-Fi boosters into the system -  I can only use Vodafone's boosters. I declined their generous offer. Worst case, I'll just have to pay up the contract and move on. First and last time with Vodafone though. So disappointing.

Review: Went in to the Vodafone store today to check savings / finished contracts and Manoj served me at the store and was amazingly knowledgeable with the plans and offers available to me and save me a chunk of money on my monthly bill me and my wife walked away very happy with the service and would recommend anyone who needs help discussing there bill to go in and just speak to someone

Review: I requested a home broadband upgrade to Full Fibre 910 Broadband on February 18, 2025, and scheduled the inspection between 8:00 and 13:00 on March 25, 2025. I received an official contract on February 18, 2025, and the order number is SBL-1000000772627539.Since no one contacted me regarding the inspection on or before March 25, 2025, I reached out to your online customer service. The agent informed me that there was indeed an upgrade request, but it had been canceled without any explanation.First, I had scheduled a broadband inspection for that day, but there was no communication or notification. I only found out that it had been canceled after I inquired. This resulted in a waste of my time, as I had waited for over a month for the engineer‚Äôs inspection.Secondly, why was the contract canceled without any explanation? I was simply told to reapply at a higher price.I feel that this completely disregards the spirit of the contract.I have a formal contract with clearly stated terms that should be honored. If a customer fails to comply, your company would demand compensation. So why is it acceptable for your company to unilaterally breach the contract?My request is very simple ‚Äî just to honor our contract. I should not have to reapply at a higher price.

Review: I recently decided to switch to Vodafone for broadband services after hearing good things about the company. However, I encountered an unexpected and frustrating issue with their credit check process that has left me very dissatisfied. While I understand that credit checks are part of the application process, I was surprised to be rejected despite having a strong credit score. I regularly monitor my credit and ensure my bills are paid on time. My latest Experian score is 975 out of 999, which reflects my commitment to maintaining good financial health.The reason I applied with Vodafone was to manage broadband for my family, particularly helping my parents with their technology needs. My mum is partially blind, and I decided to take the lead on managing their broadband services to ensure they have reliable access to the internet and support with any technical issues. To be rejected based on a credit check was disappointing, especially when I know my financial standing is more than adequate, particularly considering other companies do not require a credit check for broadband. Internet access is increasingly viewed as a necessity, not a luxury, due to its vital role in education, work, communication, and accessing essential services‚Äîespecially after the COVID-19 pandemic highlighted its crucial role. I was informed that I could appeal the decision, which I did, outlining the reasons behind my application, including my strong credit score and the fact that I have dyslexia, which may have caused errors on my application form. However, after appealing, I received an email stating that my application had been reviewed and would remain declined because I had not met the minimum criteria to progress. This response felt dismissive, and I couldn't help but feel that my disability and the reasoning I provided had been completely ignored.Instead of just rejecting my application, I would have appreciated more transparency, flexibility, or at least a chance to review the situation further. It‚Äôs frustrating to feel like my good credit record and valid reasoning weren‚Äôt enough to warrant a second look, especially when the appeal process felt like a formality rather than a genuine review. Overall, I expected better service from Vodafone, and the credit check rejection has left a very negative impression. I‚Äôm reconsidering my choice of broadband provider and would caution others who might have similar experiences.
Name: Anonymous

Review: I used the Oxford Street store in London . The assistant Brian who was assigned to me could not have been less helpful . He was disinterested to the point of rudeness and did not sort out the problem , but made it worse . I shall be moving away from Vodafone as my provider .

Review: So I just went to the customer services to ask about the end of my contract. When I first started with Vodafone I also signed up to get a pay as you go SIM card to get a second line but when it arrived the number had clearly been cloned as someone hacked my accounts using the number as I put it in my phone. So I‚Äôve been waiting 11 months more or less for this contract to end. Which it does in four days. I asked for information about cancelling the contract, to see if I can terminate it or get it to just not renew: not only was the service agent super slow but they didn‚Äôt listen to what I wanted and tried to terminate early and therefore charge me for early termination, despite my repeatedly saying I will wait if I have to but can it automatically switch off etc.Appalled and can‚Äôt stand them. Review: Don't be misled into thinking that Vodafone provides good customer service. Their support is based in India, and the advisors often have strong Indian accents. Everything they say is not backed up in writing, as they claim to be "not authorized" to provide confirmations. For example, one advisor provided a broadband connection date, but just two minutes later, an email was sent with a different connection date, which was a week later‚Äîthis seems to be an attempt to entice you. When you question the date change, they blame another provider without mentioning that a third-party connection service is in control. Vodafone even sent an email cancelling the new connection, again blaming the current supplier despite their previous service promises. , they promise dates and then shift the blame to others to gain business.It's time wasted and not good business practice, and you pay for the privilege.

Review: I have received an email from Vodafone with an offer to upgrade my broadband as my contract is going to finish soon. I wanted to upgrade my speed. I went through a chat with an agent, agreed an upgrade and received a new ultra hub a few days later. Meantime they contacted me telling me my upgrade has been cancelled due to a technical issue. I went on a chat again, got slightly better price and agreed the upgrade again. A few days later they contacted me telling me my upgrade has been cancelled again because it has been put through with a wrong landline number - clearly an agent error again. I contacted them 3rd time, this time I have got worse deal then the previous 2. The person was absolutely ignorant. Clearly talking to someone else during the chat as it took her long time to respond. When I told her I'm going to leave Vodafone because I have enough, she tried to sell me a SIM card contract because "perhaps someone can use it on my account". Shocking customer service. Additionally half of my home devices stopped to work with this new ultra hub. I'm happy my contract ends soon and I can find another provider.Edit: Stope telling people to reach you out if cannot even offer an upgrade to an EXISTING customer because of your incapable employees. Your customer service is shockingly bad. I'm not going to waste my time again.
